author: 21pages
title: port forward, wait until TestDelay is replied
body:
The reason why the rdp connection failed before was that when connecting with a password, the control end first received the TestDelay, send TestDelay back and then immediately received the LoginResponse. At the same time, the controlled end had ended the `on_message` loop and TestDelay was sent to the RDP server.

Now port forward will wait until TestDelay is replied, and will not send TestDelay when port forward is authorized.

Tested rdp/tcp tunneling with/without password.

author: fufesou
title: Fix. Text clipboard is not working correctly
body:
https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/issues/6859

### Bug

If there're multiple connections, and one connection is going to end.

We need to check if clipboard checking loop should be stoped.

The previous check is wrong. So the checking loop is early exited.

### Fixed

Change

```rust
    pub fn other_sessions_running(peer_id: String, conn_type: ConnType) -> bool {
        SESSIONS
            .read()
            .unwrap()
            .get(&(peer_id, conn_type))
            .map(|s| s.session_handlers.read().unwrap().len() != 0)
            .unwrap_or(false)
}
```

to

```rust
    pub fn has_sessions_running(conn_type: ConnType) -> bool {
        SESSIONS.read().unwrap().iter().any(|((_, r#type), s)| {
            *r#type == conn_type && s.session_handlers.read().unwrap().len() != 0
        })
    }
```

author: fufesou
title: Fix/arboard clipboard context timeout
body:
This PR may fix https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/issues/6859 on Linux platform.

### Issue

`arboard` uses a fixed duration(10ms) as the timeout for x11 connection. 


https://github.com/1Password/arboard/blob/77e0e078eb460ac2fa0eda96124163c11ef6b2d1/src/platform/linux/x11.rs#L142


But for RustDesk, sometimes it needs about 20ms or more to connect x11.

So the text clipboard is not stable.

And if the following line fails, the "copy & paste" from client to host will not work anymore in that connection.

https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/blob/7b317619acdf26853e05c5e398f5bdc19fee776c/src/client.rs#L726 


### Fixed 

In this PR, retry and increasing timeout are added for `new()` and `get_text()`.

```rust
        for i in 1..4 {
            arboard::Clipboard::set_x11_server_conn_timeout(dur * i);
            match arboard::Clipboard::new() {
                Ok(c) => return Ok(ClipboardContext(c)),
                Err(arboard::Error::X11ServerConnTimeout) => continue,
                Err(err) => return Err(err.into()),
            }
        }
        bail!("Failed to create clipboard context, timeout");
```

PR for `arboard` is also submitted.
files: Cargo.lock, Cargo.toml, src/client.rs, src/client/io_loop.rs, src/common.rs, src/server/clipboard_service.rs

https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/blob/7b317619acdf26853e05c5e398f5bdc19fee776c/src/client.rs#L726 


### Fixed 

In this PR, retry and increasing timeout are added for `new()` and `get_text()`.

```rust
        for i in 1..4 {
            arboard::Clipboard::set_x11_server_conn_timeout(dur * i);
            match arboard::Clipboard::new() {
                Ok(c) => return Ok(ClipboardContext(c)),
                Err(arboard::Error::X11ServerConnTimeout) => continue,

        bail!("Failed to create clipboard context, timeout");
```

PR for `arboard` is also submitted.

author: 21pages
title: refactor windows specific session
body:
https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/pull/6825
1. Modify the process to have the control side lead the session switching: After the control side sends a `LoginRequest`, the controlled side will add all session information and the current session ID in the `LoginResponse`. Upon receiving the `LoginResponse`, the control side will check if the current session ID matches the ID in the `LoginConfigHandler`. If they match, the control side will send the current session ID. If they don't match, a session selection dialog will pop up, the selected session id will be sent. Upon receiving this message, the controlled side will restart if different or sub service if same .
2. Always show physical console session on the top
3. Show running session and distinguish sessions with the same name
4. Not sub remote services or call `read_dir` until correct session id is ensured
5. Fix switch sides not work for multisession pc
6. Remove all session string join/split except get_available_sessions in windows.rs, account name can use '-'
7. Fix prelogin, when share rdp is enabled and there is a rdp session, the console is in login screen, get_active_username will be the rdp's username and prelogin will be false, cm can't be created and that causes disconnection in a loop
8. Rename all user session variable to windows session
9. Session select dropdown uses the same widget as in setting page.
10. Fix file transfer, caused by `pi.username = self.lc.read().unwrap().get_username(&pi);` overide empty username and `get_active_username` doesn't return current session username
* Fix home directory not change when session changed, or wrong home directory
* Fix show empty remote directory rather than error messagbox when current session is in login screen,  

Known issue:
1. Use current process session id for `run_as_user`, sahil says it can be wrong but I didn't reproduce.
2. Have not change tray process to current session

![90dd5859c32ad5c3f61156c20aa6ea1](https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/assets/14891774/dc36acde-6af9-4e05-9403-bcd317380e6c)


Flutter version connect to windows server 2019 with 2 rdp session and console session logged out

https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/assets/14891774/0261d759-eff6-4436-89e8-e5b610a0a2b4

Sciter version connect to windows 10 with 1 rdp session and console session logged out

https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/assets/14891774/6daef9b6-1b97-45d4-b439-5db3122ab825

author: 21pages
title: windows specific session, not show remote screen until correct session id is ensured
body:
#6825 
1.  The controlled side doesn't know the selected session id  util the control side choose it, in order to show black screen when switching session id:
* For Windows multi-active sessions, the subscription to the remote service will be delayed until the control side selects the session id, so I use a "INVALID" session id to show the control side can respond to the `RdpUserSessions` message
* For others, subscribe directly 
2. Fix switch sides not work for reconnect, which would cause using the old uuid to send `SwitchSidesResponse` rather than `LoginRequest` for reconnection, and makes switching side to multi-session Windows not work.

notice:
If connect to a minisized rdp session window, it'll always be "Connected, waiting for image" until the window is restored.

https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/assets/14891774/f388d6a4-fa3b-417e-9b11-fd073013abed

author: 21pages
title: upgrade flutter to 3.16.9
body:
1. Tested on win10, win11, macos, ubuntu22, android
2. Reasons for some code changes:
*  flutter 3.16 uses Material3 by default, set false to keep the ui unchanged
*  Resulotion menu  cannot pass the context because it is already unmounted when clicked with flutter 3.16.9
* CMakeLists.txt is auto updated
* pubspec.lock have not been updated
3. Found some issues unrelated to flutter 3.16.9
* Crash when connected as server side on fedora 38, `Cannot drop a runtime in a context where blocking is not allowed. This happens when a runtime is dropped from within an asynchronous context.`

author: 21pages
title: video handler holds only one decoder of the current codec format
body:
1. For example: when receiving h264 video frames, only one h264 decoder is created, priority: vram > ram
2. For creation and decoding failed:

  * Remove real_supported_decodings, this will update real existing decoders, replace it with the `mark_unsupported` vector. After creating the decoder failure, marks the codec as unsupported and updates supported decoding to the controlled side
  *  Add `fail_counter` in the decoder. When decoding 10 consecutive frames failed, adding codec type to `mark_unsupported` vector
  *  The controlled end always ignores the unavailability of VP9

test:
* 1.2.4 control 1.1.9~1.2.4
* In this test video, the default codec  is AV1, let AV1 and H264 fail to be created, and let H265 fail to decode after 100 frames.

https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/assets/14891774/4f033b03-33b0-4c19-b340-731b1842900d
files: libs/scrap/examples/benchmark.rs, libs/scrap/src/common/codec.rs, libs/scrap/src/common/gpucodec.rs, libs/scrap/src/common/hwcodec.rs, libs/scrap/src/common/mediacodec.rs, libs/scrap/src/common/mod.rs, src/client.rs, src/ui_interface.rs, src/ui_session_interface.rs

author: 21pages
title: Fix ab merge and sync from recent
body:
1. Fixed missing "platform" field from recent sync. This issue causes the platform icon to be lost when using Add ID and then syncing from recent. This did not result in multiple pushes.
https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/blob/58fd8780e537239fa07dd877ac48b19e3698d375/flutter/lib/models/ab_model.dart#L455
2. Fix calling the syncFromRecent before ab is initialized. If syncFromRecent option is on, and there are more recent devices than licensed devices, the permitted device count is unknown when calling syncFromRecent , all recent devices are pushed to ab, then after pullAb, the devices are truncated and in front What's in the list is the result.

author: wesley800
title: Warn on MIT-SHM not working on Linux X11
body:
This PR simply throws a warn into log, when rustdesk server runs on an Linux box with its X11 server having MIT-SHM set to disabled. Plus another minor fix on pointer usage.
Personally I'm very unsatisfied about the current way of passing MIT-SHM errors from `scrap` to the server. Need some hint on API designing flavors.

author: fufesou
title: Set mouse position before sending 'down' event and after entering remote page
body:
https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/issues/6686


## Reason

Current implementations of window event grabbing are different.

For MacOS, if the remote window is not active. No 'enter' or 'leave' event will be triggered.


https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/assets/13586388/96e6f7bf-ae9f-4280-8a4a-b603b4a9107a

For Windows and Linux, event will be grabbed event the window is not active.


https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/assets/13586388/099a46e4-2e4e-451c-b16d-bb4df9edd770



### Bug

macOS -> Win

https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/assets/13586388/6b9febc5-231b-46d9-a661-673a3165b5f7

### Fixed

Send `RefreshMousePos()` before sending click down event.

https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/assets/13586388/69c962a2-2a65-42ed-a733-0b5fa8c6a646

author: kaaass
title: feat: Support new http-mq rendezvous protocol
body:
This PR provides client-side support for the new http-mq rendezvous protocol. The purpose of the new http-mq rendezvous protocol is to offer a rendezvous messaging communication method that doesn't require UDP, while maintaining support for the existing tcp-udp rendezvous protocol. Specifically, this PR implements client-side support for the following messages:

- HTTP/HTTPS Request
  - `/api/get_token`
    - Token server and `/api/get_token` endpoint is introduced to solve the authentication problem between Client and MQ server. While handshaking, the Client will send a request to the Token server to get `temp_mq_token`.  The Client will connect to MQ server with `temp_mq_token` to perform other handshake actions.
    - Apart from `temp_mq_token`, the URL of the MQ server and the other connection detail will be retrieved by this.

- MQ Messages
  - `RegisterPk` and `RegisterPkResponse`
    - Request-response type messages, previously sent by hbbs using UDP protocol. In http-mq protocol, these messages will be sent through MQ using NATS's request-reply mode.
    - `RegisterPk` message sent using MQ carries the semantics of a "handshake" for establishing a connection between the client and the server. The server's response message, `RegisterPkResponse`, now includes an extra `mq_token` field. The client will use the `mq_token` as an authentication credential to establish a long connection with the mq server.
    - The `mq_token` has much more permission compared to `temp_mq_token`. This is expected to avoid abusing of mq server.

  - `RegisterPeer`, `RegisterPeerResponse`
    - Request-response type messages, previously sent by hbbs using UDP protocol. In http-mq protocol, these messages will be sent using mq, utilizing the topic `ping.[node_id]`. The direction of message sending remains the same as existing messages. That is, `RegisterPeer` is sent from the client to the server via topic `ping.[node_id]`, after which server sends `RegisterPeerResponse` to client using topic `push.[node_id]`.

  - `PunchHole`, `RequestRelay`, `FetchLocalAddr`
      - Previously pushed actively to the client by hbbs using the UDP protocol. In http-mq protocol, these messages will be sent using mq, utilizing the topic `push.[node_id]`.

  - `ConfigureUpdate`
     - This message is an optional response to the `RegisterPeer` message, previously sent by hbbs using UDP protocol after `RegisterPeerResponse`. In http-mq protocol, these messages will be sent using mq, utilizing the topic `push.[node_id]`.

Apart from the messages mentioned above, there still exists some rendezvous messages sent through TCP protocol in udp-tcp protocol, e.g., `PunchHoleRequest`. These messages are not affected by this PR.

## Limitations

1. The ability to establish a NATS MQ connection via a user-specified socks5 proxy has not yet been implemented.
2. Using specific certification to verify NATS TLS connection hasn't been implemented yet.

## Tests

| Test Function | Test Item                                        | Test Result |
| ------------- | ------------------------------------------------ | ----------- |
| TCP Hole Punching Connection | $C_{new}P_{http-mq} \to C_{old}P_{tcp-udp}$ | ✅ |
|               | $C_{new}P_{tcp-udp} \to C_{old}P_{tcp-udp}$ | ✅ |
|               | $C_{old}P_{tcp-udp} \to C_{new}P_{http-mq}$ | ✅ |
|               | $C_{old}P_{tcp-udp} \to C_{new}P_{tcp-udp}$ | ✅ |
| Relay Connection | $C_{new}P_{http-mq} \to C_{old}P_{tcp-udp}$ | ✅ |
|               | $C_{old}P_{tcp-udp} \to C_{new}P_{http-mq}$ | ✅ |
| Custom ID | $C_{new}P_{http-mq}$ | ✅ |
|               | $C_{old}P_{tcp-udp}$ | ✅ |
| `mq_token` Expire | Able to reconnect after expire | ✅ |
|               | Still http-mq protocol after reconnection | ✅ |
| hbbs Service Restart | Able to reconnect after restart | ✅ |
|               | Still http-mq protocol after reconnection | ✅ |
| MQ Service Restart | Able to reconnect after restart | ✅ |
|               | Still http-mq protocol after reconnection | ✅ |

**Note**: 
- In the notation $C_{new/old}P_{http-mq/tcp-udp}$:
  - $C_{new}$ and $C_{old}$ denote the client using a new version (after this PR) or old version (1.2.3), respectively.
  - $P_{http-mq}$ and $P_{tcp-udp}$ represent using the http-mq protocol or tcp-udp protocol, respectively.

author: sahilyeole
title: Feat: Wayland flatpak input support | Remote desktop portal
body:
## Fixes #5949 
## Description:
Utilise the [remote desktop portal](https://flatpak.github.io/xdg-desktop-portal/docs/doc-org.freedesktop.portal.RemoteDesktop.html) interface (provided by xdg desktop portal) when uinput is unavailable for input capture on wayland.
## Advantages:
Wayland input is supported similar to uinput on:
1. Flatpak
2. While dev/debugging (cargo/flutter run)
## Supports:
It supports input from:
- Desktop
- Mobile
- Physical keyboard mobile

Events:
- Key inputs
- Mouse movements, clicks, and scroll (x & y axis)
## Tested:
Remote: ubuntu, arch (kde, gnome)
Local: mac, linux, ios, android
## Note:
During testing, I found an issue that occurs even without the changes of this PR (also occurs on 1.2.3):
- Mobile -> ubuntu wayland flatpak stream freezes but input still works (rdp input; enabled by this PR).
## Build for test/review:
[rustdesk-1.2.4-x86_64_wl_rdp.flatpak](https://github.com/sahilyeole/rustdesk/releases/download/nightly/rustdesk-1.2.4-x86_64_wl_rdp.flatpak)
## Test videos:

https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/assets/73148455/643e0438-9bd7-48fc-8a73-1c1519103545


https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/assets/73148455/31c45b29-b106-4afb-9d89-a50b550cb635

author: 21pages
title: use full range by default for yuv420p if supported
body:
#6518
1. Explicitly specify the color space as bt601
2. Use fullrange by default for yuv420p if supported
3. Use the pixfmt-space-range format to identify codec capabilities, make i444 proto field deprecated, and cause the non-release version of 444 true color to fail.

After the change, all colors in the image below are accurate for VP9 420 and AV1 420, but still inaccurate when r,g,b are not equal.
The conversion between yuv and rgb is irreversible, so there will be a loss of accuracy.
Teamviewer and parsec are inaccurate in both cases, anydesk accurate in both cases.
tested all codecs, 1.2.4->1.2.3, 1.2.3->1.2.4 on windows.
![image](https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/assets/14891774/f732a5a0-8cd2-42b7-b2ee-e063f9845476)

author: sahilyeole
title: Fix: wayland repeated share screen prompts
body:
Fixes: https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/pull/5900#issuecomment-1751999206

The check for 'supported resolutions' and 'change in displays' does not work on wayland.
These were making unnecessary calls to get display on wayland. The implementation for getting display on wayland requests the user for screen share permission hence causing infinite share screen prompts.
I have skipped these two functionalities specific for wayland.

We got away with it on gnome because of 'Remember selection' option but this option is not available on some kde environments such as ubuntu 22.04 kde.
On a side note as I'm working on implementing remote desktop portal for https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/issues/5949, it does not have the 'Remember selection' option so it was required to fix this issue first.

Tested: gnome + kde on arch, ubuntu
Also tested x11, windows and android to ensure they are unaffected

author: 21pages
title: fix windows wakelock
body:
#6615
1. Fix windows wakelock not work introduced by #6520,  set and clear the wakelock flag within a single thread, https://stackoverflow.com/questions/48142101/setthreadexecutionstate-for-another-thread, tested on macos/android. On Ubuntu 22.04, the display flag does not work, and the operating system is not able to enter sleep mode, same as before.
![1701774080419](https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/assets/14891774/507e1378-f228-4229-a2f0-ca80ef6d884c)
2. There is a possibility that the CPU will immediately stop working when dropping the previous wakelock, although it has never happened in tests. Windows/macOS change the display flag instead of dropping it, and Linux also uses display=true for file transfer, android doesn't use display flag.

author: fufesou
title: Feat/input source
body:
# 1. Introduce "Input source" option.

    **"Input source 1"** uses [rdev](https://github.com/fufesou/rdev), is the default option. 

    **"Input source 2"** uses flutter Focus -> onKey https://api.flutter.dev/flutter/widgets/Focus/onKey.html to grab key events. But some system shortcuts like "Alt + Tab", "Command + Tab" cannot be sent to the remote side.

https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/assets/13586388/a2dac054-e85e-46af-b296-1d3c2644b6a7

# 2. MacOS, grab tap `CGEventTapLocation::HID` to `CGEventTapLocation::Session`. The grabbing states may be reset with this tap.

author: 21pages
title: android video service wakelock
body:
#6192
Without using battery optimization,  without using lock to avoid background killing,  after screen off
* without wakelock: disconnect after 3 minutes 
* with wakelock: stay connected for 20 minutes  (maybe never disconnect, test later).

The android_context used by android-wakelock needs to be initialized and it should be managed in only one place, otherwise there is a risk of crash. `cpal` and `oboe` also use it,  and there is no context management in them, which is expected. 
https://github.com/sagebind/android-wakelock/blob/master/src/lib.rs#L252
https://github.com/rust-mobile/ndk-context/blob/0eb252bf2306f6ca477430a35e88298e634c0b24/ndk-context/src/lib.rs#L84

move `init(this)` from `onStartCommand` to `onCreate` to look more reasonable, because there is no function like `uninit()`

author: kaaass
title: feat: Support new tcp-mq rendezvous protocol
body:
This PR provides client-side support for the new tcp-mq rendezvous protocol. The purpose of the new tcp-mq rendezvous protocol is to offer a rendezvous messaging communication method that doesn't require UDP, while maintaining support for the existing tcp-udp rendezvous protocol. Specifically, this PR implements client-side support for the following messages:

- TCP Messages
  - `RegisterPk` and `RegisterPkResponse`
    - Request-response type messages, previously sent by hbbs using UDP protocol. In tcp-mq protocol, these messages will be sent using a short TCP connection, i.e., a TCP connection is opened to the hbbs server for sending, and it is disconnected after receiving the expected response message.
    - `RegisterPk` message sent using TCP carries the semantics of a "handshake" for establishing a connection between the client and the server. The server's response message, `RegisterPkResponse`, now includes an extra `mq_token` field. The client will use the `mq_token` as an authentication credential to establish a connection with the mq server (Using port `21120/tcp`). This is expected to avoid abusing of mq server.

- MQ Messages
  - `RegisterPeer`, `RegisterPeerResponse`
    - Request-response type messages, previously sent by hbbs using UDP protocol. In tcp-mq protocol, these messages will be sent using mq, utilizing the topic `ping.[node_id]`. The direction of message sending remains the same as existing messages. That is, `RegisterPeer` is sent from the client to the server via topic `ping.[node_id]`, after which server sends `RegisterPeerResponse` to client using topic `push.[node_id]`.

  - `PunchHole`, `RequestRelay`, `FetchLocalAddr`
      - Previously pushed actively to the client by hbbs using the UDP protocol. In tcp-mq protocol, these messages will be sent using mq, utilizing the topic `push.[node_id]`.

  - `ConfigureUpdate`
     - This message is an optional response to the `RegisterPeer` message, previously sent by hbbs using UDP protocol after `RegisterPeerResponse`. In tcp-mq protocol, these messages will be sent using mq, utilizing the topic `push.[node_id]`.

## Limitations

1. The ability to establish a NATS MQ connection via a user-specified socks5 proxy has not yet been implemented.
2. The implementation of JWT token authentication on a per-peer basis is still pending. Currently, only a version based on token authentication has been implemented. Although this coarser-grained authentication method can prevent attackers from abusing the MQ for message passing (as long as the admin and regular user accounts are not compromised simultaneously), it still does not restrict peers from listening to messages from other peers. It is necessary to employ JWT tokens for fine-grained ACL (Access Control List) access control for different peers.

## Tests

- ✅ New Client → New Client, local network (Both clients using TCP + NATS, trying to establish remote control session)
- ✅ New Client → Old Client, hole punching (TCP + NATS client send remote control request to UDP client)
- ✅ Old Client → New Client, hole punching
- ✅ New Client → Old Client, relay
- ✅ Old Client → New Client, relay
- ✅ New Client connects to Old Server
- ✅ New Client change ID
- ✅ Old Client change ID
- ✅ When hbbs server restarts, new client should be able to reconnect
- ⏳ Online config update for new client
files: Cargo.lock, Cargo.toml, libs/hbb_common/Cargo.toml, libs/hbb_common/protos/rendezvous.proto, libs/hbb_common/src/config.rs, libs/hbb_common/src/socket_client.rs, src/rendezvous_mediator.rs

author: sahilyeole
title: Fix: wayland cursor mismatch on fractional scaling
body:
Fixes: https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/pull/6487#issuecomment-1822479852
In the case where xrandr output is not correct use stream resolution instead of xrandr for mouse resolution.
When xrandr is incorrect, it is always less than the stream resolution.
Cursor mismatch on a single screen or a monitor at (0,0) pixel coordinate is solved.

xrandr is only incorrect when fractional scaling(experimental feature) is enabled on gnome on distros like fedora, debian. Ubuntu does not have this issue neither kde, they both support fractional scaling officially.
Currently, the cursor will still be mismatched if the user has **multi-monitor+gnome(other than ubuntu)+wayland+fractional scaling enabled**. It may be a less common scenario but it's worth noting. #5773 #4288 
On the official release of fractional scaling on gnome, if this issue gets addressed and xrandr produces the correct value in that case this particular problem (multi-monitor+fractional scaling) will be solved on its own. I could not find any better way to get max desktop resolution on wayland other than xrandr.

**If you are using **multi-monitor+gnome(other than ubuntu)+wayland+fractional scaling enabled** just turn the scaling back to 100% and the cursor will work perfectly.**

author: kaaass
title: WIP: refactor: Replace UDP protocol to TCP + NATS MQ
body:
This PR refactors the original UDP communication in RustDesk Rendezvous to use TCP and NATS messaging queues. Specifically, this PR involves refactoring the following UDP messages:

- `RegisterPeer`, `RegisterPeerResponse`
  - Request-response type messages, previously sent using UDP protocol. Now using NATS MQ, utilizing the topic `ping.[node_id]`. The direction of message sending remains consistent with existing messages. That is, `RegisterPeer` is sent from the client to the server hbbs via topic `ping.[node_id]`, after which hbbs sends `RegisterPeerResponse` using topic `push.[node_id]`.

- `RegisterPk` and `RegisterPkResponse`
  - Request-response type messages, previously sent by hbbs using UDP protocol. Now sent using a short TCP connection, i.e., a TCP connection is opened to the hbbs server for sending, and it is disconnected after receiving the expected return message.
  - `RegisterPkResponse` now includes the return of `mq_token`, used to create mq access tokens based on the user. Once the token is obtained, the client will connect to the messaging queue.

- `PunchHole`, `RequestRelay`, `FetchLocalAddr`
    - Previously pushed actively to the client by hbbs using the UDP protocol, now changed to use the messaging queue, utilizing the topic `push.[node_id]`.

- `ConfigureUpdate`
   - This message is an optional response to the RegisterPeer message, previously sent by hbbs using UDP protocol, and sent after `RegisterPeerResponse`. It is now changed to use the messaging queue, utilizing the topic `push.[node_id]`.

## Limitations

1. The ability to establish a NATS MQ connection via a program-specified socks5 proxy has not yet been implemented.
2. The implementation of JWT token authentication on a per-peer basis is still pending. Currently, only a version based on token authentication has been implemented. Although this coarser-grained authentication method can prevent attackers from abusing the MQ for message passing (as long as the admin and regular user accounts are not compromised simultaneously), it still does not restrict peers from listening to messages from other peers. It is necessary to employ JWT tokens for fine-grained ACL (Access Control List) access control for different peers.

## Tests

- ✅ New Client → New Client, local network (Both clients using TCP + NATS, trying to establish remote control session)
- ✅ New Client → Old Client, hole punching (TCP + NATS client send remote control request to UDP client)
- ✅ Old Client → New Client, hole punching
- ✅ New Client → Old Client, relay
- ✅ Old Client → New Client, relay
- ✅ New Client change ID
- ✅ Old Client change ID
- ✅ When hbbs server restarts, new client should be able to reconnect
- ⏳ Online config update for new client

author: dignow
title: Fix/query onlines block thread
body:
`query_onlines()` will block current thread.

The thread will block for a long time if the server is unreachable.

Fix by creating a task thread for querying, and sending ids to query through the `UnboundedSender`.

https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/assets/136106582/4623b335-fa88-4614-9248-7a501568c3a9

author: 21pages
title: not use max fps by default
body:
1. Not use max fps by default, fps will never exceed max fps,  remove full speed fps, client adjust fps with custom_fps (rather than auto_fps, because one value is sufficient to express the max fps), server still reserve auto_fps for compatibility. 
2. Only the Custom image quality option allows users to set a custom FPS. For other image qualities, the maximum FPS will be set to 30.
3. Make the automatic adjustment of FPS more responsive
4. Fix  custom_fps/custom_quality in login request, which doesn't check public or selfhost, direct or relay.

title: Feat/Windows - virtual display privacy mode

2. `check_uac_switch()` in `video_service.rs` is very expensive. Remove the one call in `video_service.rs`.
```rust
        let wait_begin = Instant::now();
        while wait_begin.elapsed().as_millis() < timeout_millis as _ {
            ...
-            #[cfg(windows)]
-            check_uac_switch(c.privacy_mode_id, c._capturer_privacy_mode_id)?;
```

## Known Issue

If the resolution of the virtual display has been modified, enabling privacy mode will fail.
`ChangeDisplaySettingsEx` will return 2.

author: fufesou
title: Fix, windows display orders
body:
![image](https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/assets/13586388/ca5448cf-9202-4460-8285-d578af9639a6)

Displays' order returned from the dxgi method does not match the order of the system dispay settings.

I could not find a way to keep the order from dxgi method.

Displays' order returned from the gdi method matches the order.

So, I introduce a new method `fn get_displays(_order: bool) -> ResultType<Vec<Display>>`, and replace all direct call of `Display::all()`.

The disadvantage is that almost everywhere uses `scrap::dxgi::Displays::get_from_gdi()` to keep the order.

author: sahilyeole
title: Fix: mobile -> wayland virtual keyboard mapping mismatch
body:
Fixes: https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/issues/5193

- [x] With a German keyboard y and z are swapped => If Wayland and Android keyboard layout is both US mapping of z and y is correct.
- [x] Write capital letters does not work using the Shift button from the Android virtual keyboard.
- [x] Special characters and numbers from Android virtual keyboard sub pages does not work.

Works for android + ios
Non ASCII characters will still not work (doesn't work on desktop -> wayland too)

https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/assets/73148455/4e521a39-56e8-4ee7-93c3-754f888a0fa9

https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/assets/73148455/3fb2e16a-eaf2-46e9-809d-d668892959de



---
Notes for review:
Currently we only support physical key input emulation on wayland. So I have updated mappings to support characters that requires to press `shift+key`.

> Non ASCII characters will still not work (doesn't work on desktop -> wayland too)

Non ASCII characters works on mobile -> x11 because `xdo` supports unicode input. I tried using `xdo` but it has bad compatibility with xwayland, it didn't work for me at all.
I tried other alternatives like [wtype](https://github.com/atx/wtype) and [ydotool](https://github.com/ReimuNotMoe/ydotool).
`wtype` supports unicode but has bad compatibility as it relies on `virtual-keyboard` protocol which is [not well adapted by many wayland compositors yet](https://github.com/atx/wtype/issues/45).
`ydotool` works on all wayland environments. It uses uinput like us but it has wider mappings support, so I just updated the mappings in our implementation. `ydotool` does not support non ASCII characters either.

author: sahilyeole
title: Feat: mobile uni link support (android + ios)
body:
https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/discussions/4669
Connect to ID using uni/deep link on mobile

Format: `rustdesk://[id]` or `rustdesk://connection/new/[id]` or `rustdesk://connect/[id]` or `rustdesk://play/[id]`
Ex: `rustdesk://13423325234` or `rustdesk://connection/new/13423325234`...

**File transfer:**
Format: `rustdesk://file-transfer/[id]`
Ex: `rustdesk://file-transfer/13423325234`

Works on cold boot as well as when the app is running in the background.


https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/assets/73148455/acc800f1-8e6a-44ee-8f90-937ba6991b6f


https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/assets/73148455/206397fc-e1fb-46df-a19b-128572ae8968

author: fufesou
title: add comemnt
body:
`Provider.of<PeerTabModel>(context, listen: false)` will not trigger rebuild.

`Provider.of<PeerTabModel>(context, listen: false)` is the same value to `gFFI.peerTabModel`.

But `Provider.of<PeerTabModel>(context, listen: false)` is used here to explicitly say "Do not use Provider.of<PeerTabModel>(context) here".

author: fufesou
title: fix, flutter, infinite loop
body:
`final model = Provider.of<PeerTabModel>(context);` gets the model instance of `gFFI.peerTabModel`.

It also has a side effect of rebuild the widget.

The previous call of `gFFI.peerTabModel.setCurrentTabCachedPeers(peers);` will `notifyListeners()`.

Then infinite loop is build.

BTW, using `gFFI.peerTabModel` and `Provider.of<PeerTabModel>(context)` at the same time can be confusing. This place is prone to bugs.

author: dignow
title: fix, win, install cert
body:
1. Use `CertOpenStore()` instead of `CertOpenSystemStoreW()`.
2. Create a certificate context by `CertCreateCertificateContext()` and then install the cert.
3. Fix potential crash when uninstalling cert. `CertDeleteCertificateFromStore()` should not be called after cert context enumeration.

Registry operations are left as an insurance.

This PR may fix the exclamation issue. But I haven't reproduced it, so I can't confirm.

author: mcfans
title: Physical keyboard to android support
body:
# Description
Support KeyEvent input in android side. Fix issue(https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/issues/3556)
/claim #3556
# Detailed Design
~~Android doesn't provide an API for send key event to the whole system, since most scenario that needs keyboard input are text input. I used android accessibility service to find current focused text input widget and set text to it. I create an invisible text input widget in InputService, and set current focusing accessibility node info's text and selection to it, send the key event to it then retrieve it's new state and set the new text back to the current focusing node.In this way, we don't need to handle what different key will do to text on our side, just use system default implementation.~~
Use [getInputMethod()](https://developer.android.com/reference/android/accessibilityservice/AccessibilityService#getInputMethod) API, then send key event to it.
# Other Approach
Register an IME to system then use that to send key stroke to system. [WIFIKeyboard](https://github.com/IvanVolosyuk/wifikeyboard) use this approach. But Android system can only have one IME at a time, receive side will not able to use their on screen IME while using RustDesk, that would make features like chatting not work.
# Changes
- Modified build.gradle to generate java code from message.proto for usage of KeyEvent in Kotlin code. KeyEvent is a struct with many field, pass its' fields through ffi is complicated, so I pass serialized data through ffi.
- Updated [rdev](https://github.com/mcfans/rdev), add android key code, make keyboard mode(map) work.
- Added canRetrieveWindowContent to accessibility_service_config.xml
# Test
Tested on:
iOS -> Android,
macOS -> Android(map mode),
windows -> Android(legacy mode)
# Compatibility
Android receive side needs update to this version to work.
iOS control side needs update to this version to show a soft keyboard.
Desktop version doesn't need update for legacy keyboard mode, need update for map keyboard mode.
# A Video
https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/assets/15027395/9464a26f-dfb0-40be-a849-698dce4f1b71

author: 21pages
title: AV1 record
body:
1. Support record AV1
AV1's codec private data is from the encode side, use four zero instead works.

2. Fix client side record, test 1.2.4 record 1.1.9~1.2.4 ok, older version can't record 1.2.4 with any codec, update if needed.
* The server side does not send SwitchDisplay on every video_service::run, older versions rely on this message to start recording.  
*  Stop recording when switching the display, because the VideoHandler is created when receiving the frame, later than the switch display command.

https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/assets/14891774/4eb7523b-3ede-457f-96bf-c3e8812d34de

Fixes:
1. In `tryGetDisplayIfNotAllDisplay()` `flutter/lib/models/model.dart`, `currentDisplay > 0` to `currentDisplay >= 0`.
2. Send messages. sync peer info and switch display.

Changes:
1. Record a global displays instance `SYNC_DISPLAYS` in `display_service.rs`.
2. Send sync peer info message when the displays are changed.
3. Send switch display `try_broadcast_display_changed()` in `video_service.rs`.


Changing resolution works fine in "Ver 1.2.2". This commit is also tested with "Ver 1.2.2".

author: dignow
title: fix, non-texture render, next_rgba
body:
Fix several bugs, if build without `flutter_texture_render` feature (including Android).

1. `next_rgba()`, set the valid rgba flag to be false. Critical logic error. This will prevent updating the image.
2. `updateCurDisplay()`, move `_rect = newRect;` after updating current display values of cursor model. 2. `updateCurDisplay()`, update the current display value of the cursor model and then move `_rect = newRect;`. This will result in incorrect mouse or touch position handling.
3. Remove the "merged displays image" choise and "Show displays as individual windows" option.

author: dignow
title: feat, multi_flutter_ui_sessions
body:
https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/issues/486

## Main changes

1. Support multiple screen capture on the server side. 
2. Support screen merging.


## Unsupported

1. Screen merging, sciter version.
2. Multiple screen capture, wayland.
3. Multiple screen capture, privacy mode.

## Tests

- [x] The control side, windows, linux, macOS.
- [x] Multi screen on windows, linux, as the controlled side.
- [ ] Multi screen on macOS, as the controlled side.
- [x] Compatible with old version.
- [x] "Scale Original", "Scale Adaptive" and scroll style.


https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/assets/136106582/ed476a8f-74a9-49ed-81d7-454103b84927


https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/assets/136106582/010138d9-813f-42b3-8eeb-20f3049628ef




The flutter ui session hierarchy is a bit complicated now.


![flutter-session-hierarchy](https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/assets/136106582/3e83f930-b320-472a-a9f0-3dfbb96efc3c)

## Note

The Win -> Win is the latest version. The option is refactored.

## TODOs
1. Open N windows, in different monitors or positions. Each window show each monitor.

author: fufesou
title: fix, cursor (hotx,hoty) mismatch sometimes
body: Fix cursor (hotx,hoty) mismatch sometimes. 1. The Main changes is in the `updateCursorData` function. Use local variables instead of the class member. Because the class members are shared across the async tasks. 2. Use class member `_id` to hold the last cursor id. The `_id` is updated in a sync function `updateLastCursorId`. ## How to reproduce more easily 1. Add a class member `int ct = 0` in `class CursorModel`. 2. Add the following sleep in `updateCursorData`.

author: 21pages
title: opt cm width and elevation requires keyboard permission
body:
1. opt cm width
* One-way rendering: Previously, the chat page would appear simultaneously as the window width changed. Now, the chat page's visibility depends on the window width. It will only show up when the window width is greater than 300. I didn't reproduce the error, but this would ensure a one-way rendering order.
* Keep right page size unchanged: The cm window has an invisible border, and the width of the border varies across different systems. The actual rendered width is different from the set width. Noww Ensure that the width of the right page remains unchanged before and after displaying the chat page by using LayoutBuilder.

nightly: right page has a little width change

https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/assets/14891774/c1651aef-3b1b-41ec-869a-243e3fb5c57e

pr

https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/assets/14891774/05732ee1-cb23-499f-ba23-55184ee2f981

* Sometimes setSizeAlignment not work, not fix it yet.

2. elevation 
* let elevation require keyboard permission, and there is no prompt for the user to request elevation when keyboard permission is not available. 
* Previously, when the request failed, the "wai-uac" window would block the main window, and the only way to close the window was through the taskbar. Now, if the request fails, the "wait-uac" window will be closed automatically, and a manual close button will be added on the "wait-uac" window.
* Prompt elevation for any elevated foreground window, remove filter.

author: dignow
title: fix, reconnect deadlock, introduce connection round control
body:
https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/issues/5849

Fix deadlock.

Introduce the connection state in `reconnect`:
1. If current session is connecting, do not reconnect.
2. If the connection is established, send `Data::Close`.
3. If the connection is disconnected, do nothing.

Use connection round to update the connection state.

https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/assets/136106582/84d96252-3dad-4eaa-ba24-7f2e640f26e0

author: 21pages
title: fix request elevation menu not displayed when reconnect
body:
https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/issues/5864

When reconnecting, FFI will not be reset, leaving portable service running flag to be true, which causes the problem.

For client side, reset running to false when receive peer info. Receiving peer info will always be ahead of receiving running status, so it is no harm.
For server side, always send the running status to client at start, this ensures that older version clients can correctly display the request menu.

author: dignow
title: Fix/dialog button reconnect cancel
body:
1. Fix double "Reconnect". The bug is Windows only.


https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/assets/136106582/56d8410e-a97d-4b47-ba2c-b6a4dabb018c



2. `loopCloseWindow` until the window is closed. `remote_tab_page.dart`
    If click "Reconnect" and "Cancel" in a short period of time, the window may not be closed even `PostMessage(handle, WM_SYSCOMMAND, SC_CLOSE, 0)` is sent. The bug is also Windows only.  

**NOTE**:

This PR does not fix https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/issues/5849 .

## TODOs

I'll sumbit other PRs for:

1. Dead lock RwLock in `reconnect`.
2. Do not start new session when connecting.

author: 21pages
title: try fix remote tab label update
body:
https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/discussions/5820#discussioncomment-7123492

In the old implementation, `Get.find` always returns the first instance registered with `Get.put` (I'll find the reason for this behavior later). Then, updates are achieved by broadcasting alias changing events (which might cause the failing in the discussion). Now, construct a new RxString instance every time.

author: dignow
title: fix: cm await call
body:
Make sure `windowManager.waitUntilReadyToShow` is called first.
1. Add await to guarantee the calling order.
2. Use `_isCmReadyToShow` to make sure the window is ready.

## Bugs

1. Cm may crash in wrong order.
2. The window may be at the left top.

https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/assets/136106582/09b556ac-72d0-4ad9-912d-39eb6b4a8116

3. The window may be wrong size.
4. The window appears, then minimizes, then restores, then moves to the right.
5. The cm window may also disapear and even crash.

## Fixed



https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/assets/136106582/a7c4b648-9102-46cf-ae41-8c54db48d293

author: fufesou
title: fix, alt + tab, switch window, release alt state
body:
https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/issues/5778

1. Use `Event` instead of `Key` as the value to release. Because `Key` dose not store the `keycode` value which will be used to pass in the map mode.
2. If the release key is 'Alt' or 'Right Alt'. Send an additional `Alt` event. Because the controlled side may hold the 'Alt' state.
3. Use `_ffi.inputModel.enterOrLeave` instead of `bind.sessionEnterOrLeave` to reset some flags.

Please let all checks done first.

## Main changes

author: sahilyeole
title: Fix wayland cursor mismatch on multiple screens
body:
Fixes #4288
Fixed mouse resolution.
Tested Ubuntu wayland (virtual secondary display).
Works perfectly with Xwayland (enabled by default on most wayland compositors), even on different display resolutions.
But if someone doesn't have Xwayland (which I think is quite unlikely) this fix will still work in 2nd and 3rd display position cases as shown in the video below, as long as both displays have same resolutions.

Following video shows various cases of display positions (sharing display no. 2):

https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/assets/73148455/d9f1ce8e-66b8-4645-b37a-24b141998a75

author: fufesou
title: fix, macos as the controlled side, crash on disconnect
body:
https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/issues/5712

1. Remove `rdev::exit_grab();`. `rdev::grab()` is never called in the "--server" process. The `rdev::grab()` works on the portable process, but it's not necessary to call `rdev::exit_grab();`.
2. Check null ptr before operating. https://github.com/fufesou/rdev/commit/2e8221d653f4995c831ad52966e79a514516b1fa

author: 21pages
title: install service period protection
body:
1. fix dark theme error banner background color

| before | after |
| :----: | :---: |
|   ![13aeee63bfbbd03a8b550b7bfb31994](https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/assets/14891774/aa2a4360-1dd5-4c3e-bdda-97536a122ff3)  |   ![3ba416f4386ea9cdc33e3b7857dae6b](https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/assets/14891774/4f4ea067-2503-4c38-b5cb-c8f4753832f8)  |
2. remove keep cm open when there is file log in sciter version, because sciter version doesn't support
3. install service period protection, used and tested on windows/linux
* how to reproduce:
install, click stop service, click start service, uac pop up, wait for one second, click cancel on uac, it'll show "Service is not running" but can be connected. because the value of "stop-service" is temporarily reversed.
https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/blob/96215d32b76f4bdc629e98b7f02e0039664e57da/src/rendezvous_mediator.rs#L82
4. fix lan option reaction

author: 21pages
title: translate placeholder && tray tooltip and pull up
body:
- [x]  placeholder translation support
matching pattern is {},  write {value} in the UI and {} in the translation file
* example:
write in the UI: `translate("There are {24} hours in a day")`
write in the translation file: `("There are {} hours in a day", "{} hours make up a day")`
- [x] windows/mac tray tooltip show controlled session count
* show "RustDesk Service is running" or "RustDesk - ready\nX sessions"
* tooltip may not update, right click the tray then it updated, can't reproduce this problem.
- [x] if tray is killed, try start tray when a new controlled connection is established for windows flutter
- [x] windows remove "--cm-no-ui", "--cm --hide"

author: dignow
title: fix, android soft keyboard, 'delete input' on conn password
body:
"Delete" on soft keyboard has no effect, on password dialog when connecting.

Because "Delete" is grabbed by https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/blob/master/flutter/lib/models/input_model.dart#L93

But it's strange that the dialog is grabbed and only the "Delete" key is grabbed.

Now try to disable the key grabbing before the connecting is established.

author: fufesou
title: feat, mouse wheel and touchpad scroll mode, default or reverse
body:
https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/discussions/5369

![1694341808351](https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/assets/13586388/77fa9982-98c8-4807-976b-90cc6fc96836)

Add global default option and session option for "Reverse mouse wheel".


TODO:
There may be a potential bug for the default (bool) options, which use 'Y' as true and empty as false.

For example:

If one set the session option "Reverse mouse wheel" to be false, the session option is removed(set as empty).
But if the default option is then changed.

The session does not know whether to use the changed default option or the false option.

May be it is better to set "Reverse mouse wheel" to "N" if one want to disable the option.

author: 21pages
title: add file log page to cm
body:
* Only send and receive logs are shown
* For older version, client send to server doesn't have size information, because server side doesn't know the total_size.
* Not switch tabs automatically when new files are transferred
* If cm side page is open, not pop up automatically when new files are transferred 
* Show unread message count

author: fufesou
title: Refact/plug in virtual display
body:
Refact virtual display.

1. Plugin retry at most 10 times after the authentication check. The interval is 1 second.
2. Remove plug in operation when querying the displays. This is why the connection cannot be established when the virtual dislay driver is not correctly installed.
3. Check if cert is installed before plugging in virtual display.

The "the exclamation of driver" issue is hard to reproduce for me, and is still not fixed.

author: fufesou
title: Fix/enable menu before image
body:
https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/issues/5488

1. Enable remote toolbar after connection is established and before the image. 

`flutter/lib/desktop/pages/remote_page.dart`


https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/assets/13586388/2ee39025-8ab1-4654-8a4b-0bff05977d99



`flutter/lib/models/model.dart` is also modified for 

```dart
          Obx(
            () => _ffi.ffiModel.waitForFirstImage.isTrue
                ? emptyOverlay()
                : Offstage(),
          ),
```

2. Wrap the remote toolbar with Overlay, to enable rebuild every time on expanding the menu. And so the menu can use the latest configurations.
The master branch also wraps the remote toolbar with Overlay. And the remote image body is also wrapped in an Overlay.


https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/assets/13586388/fdd500c5-6ea2-4508-8b78-c30e5e82f33d


3. Right menu duration from 4s to 300s.

`flutter/lib/desktop/widgets/tabbar_widget.dart`

title: Refact/check non rustdesk input

https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/issues/40


1. Update dep-rdev.
2. Start grab input on the server side. To detect if any non-rustdesk input is sent.
3. Use extra field on Windows and MacOS to detect if the input is simulated by rustdesk. `enigo::ENIGO_INPUT_EXTRA_VALUE = 100`

NOTES:

2. The old implementation code was not removed. (Based on distance)

author: 21pages
title: encrypt return emtpy if exceed max len to avoid another encrypt
body:
when decrypt password failed, it will be store to encrypt again, if the length exceed max encrypt len, it won't be encrypted.
In this way, in the sync timer of the address book, loading PeerConfig causes storage, and the new storage causes reloading.
So set it to empty if exceed max encrypt len.

author: fufesou
title: fix, linux crash, rdev, xdisplay
body:
https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/issues/5429

Maybe https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/issues/4997

The simultaneous invocation of the following functions may lead to crash with errors.
"Gdk-Message: 10:07:50.275: rustdesk: Fatal IO error 11 (Resource temporarily unavailable) on X server :0."


```rust
xlib::XGrabKeyboard(
  display,
  grab_window,
  c_int::from(true),
  GrabModeAsync,
  GrabModeAsync,
  xlib::CurrentTime,
);
xlib::XFlush(display);
```

```rust
xlib::XUngrabKeyboard(display, xlib::CurrentTime);
xlib::XFlush(display);
```

```rust
xlib::XNextEvent(display, x_event);
```


https://github.com/fufesou/rdev/commit/ee3057bd97c91529e8b9daf2ca133a5c49f0c0eb

Now a mutex is applied to avoid this conflict.

author: dignow
title: Refact/tab 2 window flutter data
body:

author: dignow
title: Fix, do not restore resolution if it is not changed through the session
body:
1. If the resolution is not changed through the RustDesk session, RustDesk will not change the resolution when the session is changed. 
https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/issues/5361
MAIN CHANGES: video_service.rs
a. Remove `get_current_display_name`.
b. Remove `ORIGINAL_RESOLUTIONS` and related functions, use `CHANGED_RESOLUTIONS` instead.

2. Remove peer custom resolution if the remote resolution is not changed through the RustDesk session.
To avoid confusion, the current resolution is the same as the original resolution, while the session custom resolution still exists.
MAIN CHANGES: ui_session_interface.rs -- `handle_peer_switch_display`


https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/assets/136106582/db0ee0a8-65d9-4d66-a2d9-6e4dc7a46368


TODOs:
1. Add resolution options for the mobile version.

author: dignow
title: Fix/save frame maximized
body:
1. Do not save the window rect if is maxmized.  https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/issues/5342
2. Handle uni link "rustdesk:///".  https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/issues/5340
3. Change `_adjustRestoreMainWindowOffset`, the `top` check.

```dart
  final minWidth = 10.0;
  if ((left + minWidth) > frameRight! ||
      (top + minWidth) > frameBottom! ||
      (left + width - minWidth) < frameLeft ||
      (top - minWidth) < frameTop!) {
```
```dart
  final minWidth = 10.0;
  if ((left + minWidth) > frameRight! ||
      (top + minWidth) > frameBottom! ||
      (left + width - minWidth) < frameLeft ||
      top < frameTop!) {
```

author: 21pages
title: refactor peer card multi select
body:
1. When calling `save_config` in client.rs, do not judge the key. (The wrong order is reproduced when blocking saving in `save_ui_flutter`, but it cannot be reproduced after I adding logs.)

2. Change the way of multi-select to Flutter issues: #5244

* For desktop, remove the long press/right-click enable method and instead add a shift/icon enable method.
* When the shift key is pressed, select/unselect cards between the current click and the last click. The select/unselect action is opposite to the select status of the latest clicked card.
* when the shift key is pressed, add a border to the checkbox of the last selected.

Problem: usually, a long shift press is required to detect the shift keydown for enabling multiselect because onTap reaction is delayed, because `onDoubleTap` is also detected in multiselectionMode,  this issue won't happen when multiselect is already enabled and then `onDoubleTap` is null.

mobile:
![2601497edfa6583418ec6200c812131](https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/assets/14891774/c5dd5f5f-95fa-45ab-9c9b-c9cbebc9dea6)

author: sahilyeole
title: Improved fix for connection refused on restart/logout lightdm
body:
This PR fixes #5126, and reduces the offline time as faced in #5248 

`Login error: Connection refused` was caused due to wrong seat0 active user value. It occurred once in a while on restarting and occasionally upon logging out. It was because lightdm takes some time for user switching, whereas in my experience gdm was faster and better.

My previous PR #5212 resolved this problem not through multiple attempts but by introducing a delay, allowing lightdm to produce the correct seat0 active user value. I removed the code from #5212 as it offered no advantage since empty seat0 values were already handled.

The changes in this PR are discussed below.


**Before**

https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/assets/73148455/243b1c69-a9ce-4479-bc51-d24aa7304536

Like I said #5212 solved this issue but wasn't the best solution.

**Now**  (This PR)

https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/assets/73148455/6cb80081-af47-4f59-8a5b-f9c20c7d0921

author: dignow
title: Fix/window save pos
body:
https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/issues/5109

Save the position when the window is moved or resized.

Please merge https://github.com/rustdesk-org/rustdesk_desktop_multi_window/pull/2 first.

Notes:
1. For Windows and MacOS, save the position on moved and resized is enought.
2. For Linux, the main window does not listen the moved and resized events. It should also save the position on close.

Windows will get negative positions if the window is minimized.
While Linux does not.



https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/assets/136106582/cef180fe-679a-4a71-ad7e-8db1df70dc7c

author: 21pages
title: multi user video qos and fix quality change
body:
1. store multi user's setting in video qos
2. allow client to increase fps 
3. client transfer full speed decode fps to server
4. revert vpx use webrtc parameter, which makes the dynamic picture better, but the bitrate adjustment does not work.
5. codec set quality seperately. Make sure the distinction between different image quality is obvious, and the highest image quality behaves well for dynamic scenes, Still not good for relay connection. 
6. Automatically adjust q_max/q_min according to custom bitrate
7. uses the remaining 50%(win: cpu usage, unix: loadavg) of cpu as codec thread.
8. Even in direct connections, lower bitrate can get lower fps because of frame drop and  failed encoding.

author: bwoebi
title: Allow to explicitly increase the bitrate massively
body:
This has the benefit - over direct connections - to be able to send a lot more data. In particular fast moving frames may avoid fps drops (or short stutter) with a higher target bitrate.

See also: #4682

I'm currently hiding the functionality well behind an extra checkbox you need to tick to be able to select up to 40x the bitrate. Not sure on the proper UI, but I'm open to any suggestions, maybe also some hint in a tooltip that this should only be used on peer to peer connections or dedicated servers?

author: ClSlaid
title: feature: support building with msys2 toolchains
body:
Related: https://github.com/rustdesk-org/magnum-opus/pull/2

This PR should add build support for msys2 toolchains under Windows system. This PR may also benefit trials for getting rid of `vcpkgs` and cross compiling. 

No `vcpkgs` and VS toolchains required to build the software. You need to got msys2 toolchains installed in your path, and acquire related packages like build-essentials, `pkgconf`, `libyuv`, `opus`, etc, on your msys2 toolchain. Its `pkg-config` fits well with `build.rs` and can handle dependencies perfectly.

I've built with the `ucrt64` toolchain and successes.

```bash
# on windows machine
# targetting x86_64-pc-windows-gnu
# don't forget this feature
cargo build --features="msys2-pkg-config"
wget https://raw.githubusercontent.com/c-smile/sciter-sdk/master/bin.win/x64/sciter.dll
mv sciter.dll target/debug
cargo run --features="msys2-pkg-config"
```

Showcases:

author: dignow
title: Fix/win privacy broker
body:
1. Do not start broker.exe on create cm.
    In the past, when the cm process was started, the broker process was started, because it was relatively slow to create a window in privacy mode, which took about 2 seconds. This window was created in advance.
2. Kill broker.exe on start server.
3. Kill broker.exe on tray "Exit".
5. Kill reset privacy mag window on all sessions end. The broker.exe is terminated.

body:

1. flutter add file-transfer/port forward/rdp command line/uri link support
2. put uri link handling to one function.

Tested on windows/linux
cmd: 
**rustdesk --connect \<id\> [--password \<password\>] [--relay]**
**rustdesk \<uri link\>**
uni link:
**rustdesk://connection/new/\<id\>?password=\<password\>&relay=true**
**rustdesk://connect/\<id\>?password=\<password\>&relay=true**

`connect` can be replaced by `file-transfer`/`port-forward`/`rdp`

author: 21pages
title: fix encrypt
body:
1. remove peers platform filter
2. set the maximum encrypted input length to 128 bytes, because the length of the sha256 hash result is 256 bits, and the length of other string passwords is generally not greater than 128 bytes.
3. update machine-uid, let x86 sciter program can read x64's machine id, so they can share the encrypted data.  https://github.com/Hanaasagi/machine-uid/pull/4

author: natfrp-bot
title: Fix relay connection for key exchange enabled rendezvous server
body:
Current implementation of `Client::request_relay` reads the first message from rendezvous server.
When the server has key exchange enabled, the first message would be KeyExchange, thus the relay request will always fail
This PR fixes the issue above with `get_next_nonkeyexchange_msg`.

Note: we might need to do a key exchange in `Client::request_relay` too, to protect the user token.

author: dignow
title: better conditional compilation
body:
This PR is part of https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/pull/4747.

1. Remove ffi method `main_get_online_statue`, use `main_get_connect_status` instead.
2. Refactor structure.
```rust
type Status = (i32, bool, i64, String); // (status_num, key_confirmed, mouse_time, id)
```
to
```rust
#[derive(Clone, Debug, Serialize)]
pub struct UiStatus {
    pub status_num: i32,
    #[cfg(not(feature = "flutter"))]
    pub key_confirmed: bool,
    #[cfg(not(any(target_os = "android", target_os = "ios")))]
    pub mouse_time: i64,
    #[cfg(not(feature = "flutter"))]
    pub id: String,
}
```
3. Remove some warns and better  conditional compilation.

author: seffs
title: Delete 'version' key from .desktop file
body:
Similar to https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/pull/1255 and related to https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/issues/1299, running `desktop-file-validate /usr/share/applications/rustdesk.desktop` on Ubuntu 22.04 returns the following:
```
/usr/share/applications/rustdesk.desktop: error: value "1.2.0" for key "Version" in group "Desktop Entry" is not a known version
```
* "Version" refers to the Freedesktop Specification[1], not the program's one. Given that this was removed from rustdesk-link.desktop, the same should be done here.
[1] https://specifications.freedesktop.org/desktop-entry-spec/desktop-entry-spec-latest.html

author: dignow
title: Fix/user login state
body:
When RustDesk server is unreachable:
1.  Use local username.
2. Reset group info.
3. Hide address book.

When RustDesk server is reachable:
1. Refresh user info.
2. Pull group info.
3. Update address book and group info.

Store `access_token` on oidc login.

author: fufesou
title: Fix/clipboard flutter
body:
Refactor windows clipboard (file).

![image](https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/assets/13586388/4031dce6-c705-4144-8100-01842cc2b4ee)

![image](https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/assets/13586388/07c8f4b0-5b18-4750-9f9d-309e758cf276)

![image](https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/assets/13586388/8bbd0b3b-0bfc-4f12-90a7-2a4d5669275f)

A small part of the logic is modified in the `C` code.
It is mainly to modify the control logic of the `Rust` code.

Current changes may break clipboard in sciter version.  I'll modify the code in sciter version based on this code.

1. When passing messages, if the clipboard message is `MonitorReady`, `FormatList`, or `FormatDataRequest`, the message should be blocked according to the configuration. Blocking the message should notify the clipboard to avoid waiting for the message until timeout.
2. When disconnecting, both the client and server will clear the clipboard. However, only the clipboard contents created in their own session will be cleared.
3. For the Flutter version, more accurate clipboard control is provided.


TODOs (I'll fix with another PR):
1. The following system error.  `A --> B`. If `A` copies `a.txt`, B want to copy and paste it's `a.txt` to `A`, or vice versa.
![1687220293075](https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/assets/13586388/f3ee312f-94c4-482f-a176-7b9b04897686)

https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/assets/13586388/d677a506-b3d1-44e1-9ac8-ba75212fcd8c

2. Sciter version.
3. Check again whether the related issues are still there.
4. Pass the file information of the clipboard to `Rust`.

author: fufesou
title: Fix/restore resolution
body:
1. Remove `custom_resolution` in the `option` of `LoginRequest`.
2. Remove `custom_resolution` from peer config, `custom_resolutions` is added.
```
[custom_resolutions.0]
w = 1920
h = 1080

[custom_resolutions.1]
w = 1024
h = 768
```
3. Add `w` & `h` in session `switch_display`.
4. Remember last change of the custom resolution, `last_change_display`.

1. Use nv12 for hwcodec, because nv12 is native surface format and intel qsv use nv12 only,  tested on windows.
2. Wait up to 10 seconds before terminating the checking process.

author: fufesou
title: fix resolutions query on linux
body:
Fix another case that current regex cann't parse.

The rate behind `1920x1080` is `60.01*+`.

```
                Screen 0: minimum 320 x 200, current 1920 x 1080, maximum 16384 x 16384
                eDP-1 connected primary 1920x1080+0+0 (normal left inverted right x axis y axis) 344mm x 193mm
                1920x1080     60.01*+  60.01    59.97    59.96    59.93  
                1680x1050     59.95    59.88  
                1600x1024     60.17  
```

Empty, `*+` and `+` are all cases.

Answered by ChatGPT:
> In the output format of the `xrandr` command, each output lists its supported resolutions and refresh rates. Each combination of resolution and refresh rate is listed in the format `<width>x<height> <refresh>`. If the combination is the current resolution and refresh rate in use, a `*+` marker is added at the end. If the combination is another option, only a `+` marker is added.

author: fufesou
title: Feat/remember custom resolution
body:
1. Fix lang.py.
```python
-  for fn in glob.glob('./src/lang/*'):
+  for fn in glob.glob('./src/lang/*.rs'):
```
2. Add some fields in message.proto.

`Resolution original_resolution` for:
a. Reset resolution
b. Fitting local resolution
c. Check if is virtual display.

`Resolution custom_resolution` for:
a. Resume session resolution when connection is established.

3. Support for resume session resolution.   https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/issues/4359
4. Fix solutions query on Windows.
5. Fix the mismatch of current display index and current display name.
6. Refactor screen adjust by introducing a new class `ScreenAdjustor`.
7. Fix resolution on the controlled side when multi-sessions are established.
8. Fix config macro_role: serde_field_string.



https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/assets/13586388/d6bc704f-5839-411e-a671-93364d4e6f07

author: Kingtous
title: fix: window on top when url scheme received from ipc
body:
This PR moves the uri empty check into `on_url_scheme_received `, which is received from IPC.

Place the empty check directly in `parseRustdeskUri` will cause the following command fails:

- `rustdesk rustdesk://xxx`, which is required from cli and macos uni links fallback.

Tested on macOS Ventura 13.3.1.

author: Kingtous
title: fix: make event loop in tray compatible with main window
body:
Currently the menu in tray not working due to lack of Delegate, this PR reverts the tao delegate and add some interfaces to do our own logic.

Tested on macOS,

Conditions below works:

- service is not installed, invoke by uni links or just clicking the app icon in dashboard -> open successfully
- service is installed, invoke by uni links or  just clicking the app icon in dashboard -> open successfully

author: madpilot78
title: Reimplement code extracting information from file name.
body:
This code tokenizes the file name based on commas and extracts relevant parts sequentially.

`host=` is expected to be the first part.

Since Windows renames files adding (1), (2) etc. before the .exe in case of duplicates, which causes the host or key values to be garbled.

This allows using a `,` (comma) symbol as a final delimiter.

Fixes #4162

title: Fix for #4136 connection to linux refused by using wrong Xauthority file
body:
Solution:
1. Get file from sddm-greeter and startplasma-x11 (aka KDE) processes as well
2. Get users home dir from system instead of hard coded pattern /home/<user>
3. Prefer XAUTHORITY environment variable over Xorg -auth if available

Current IPv4 validation accepting non-IPv4 addresses such as `000000.010101.256.101`, `192.168.0.300`, `256.0.0.0` and bunch of other cases I mentioned in test cases. Newly defined pattern will take care all of such cases.

author: 21pages
title: Audio rechannel
body:
#3762 
1. The first commit does audio rechannel on both sides using crate [fon](https://docs.rs/fon/0.6.0/fon/), tested in issue.
2. The second commit will try the host channel first, since the device can usually play audio on lower channels, so no need to re-channel, it works on my computer, not test in issue.
3. Can't change config channel of host build_input_stream on my computer, so rechannel may be necessary.

title: add password handling in uni links handler

A small but very useful feature. Adds the param to specify a password for the link:

`rustdesk://connection/new/12345?password=1234`

Allows 1-click connection to a computer without entering a password manually.

author: Kingtous
title: feat: add iOS target for rustdesk
body:
This PR adds the iOS target to nightly ci, with serveral code refactor to complete the compilation for iOS.

Note that, we only build iOS target now, the reason why to pr this code changes before. hand is to:

- prevent more code changes which may fail the build of iOS target because of the lack of some functions for iOS.
- follow up the latest plugin hooks.
- some changes may not be the best ones, any suggestions needed.


Some functions may not be avaliable for iOS, so further test need to be done. I have no iOS devices to test it. The codesign of IPA process will be the next pr I'll do.

author: Kingtous
title: feat: add a rust example for writing a custom plugin
body:
This PR changes a dummy C example to real rust examples, for the following reason.

- With a real example in `examples/custom_plugin`, devs can easily copy the examples to develop their own custom plugins with a standard project structure.
- With Rust, we can easily use the struct and APIs in the `librustdesk` without extra extern definitions like FFI.

Note that we should only keep FFI types for all APIs, so we can create SDK with more languages support.

author: fufesou
title: fix press/release single meta key
body:
The host side may inadvertently click Numlock or CapsLock during the simulation of pressing and releasing the Meta key, causing the single Meta key to become ineffective.

```
Client Side:                Press/Release Meta
                                   |
                                   |
                                   v
Host Side:    "Press Meta"  "Click NulLock/CapsLock"  "Release Meta"
```

https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/issues/3928

author: fufesou
title: Feat/linux virtual display (headless linux)
body:
1. Linux virtual display support. https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/issues/59
2. May fix https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/issues/3592.
3. Refactor dialog. https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/pull/3764#issuecomment-1482636535 @grummbeer 
4. Add "--cm-no-ui" for virtual display. There's some `segfault` bug with "--cm" with ui on headless env.

**Only tested on Ubuntu for now.**

Prerequirements:
```bash
# Only support gnome desktop. https://www.gnome.org
# xfce4 may be supported.

# for Ubuntu
$ sudo apt install ubuntu-desktop
$ sudo apt install xserver-xorg-video-dummy
$ sudo apt install lightdm

# for Fedora
$ sudo sudo yum groups install "GNOME"
$ sudo yum install xorg-x11-drv-dummy

# for archlinux
$ pacman -S xorg xorg-server xf86-video-dummy
$ pacman -S gnome

```

Steps
```
# install rustdesk
# get rustdesk id
$ sudo rustdesk --get-id
# set password
$ sudo rustdesk --password <password>

# connect
```

TODOs:
- [ ] Do not show "Connection Error" on logout.
- [ ] Failed to start Xorg on some PCs. `parse_vt_settings: Cannot open /dev/tty0 (Permission denied)`.

author: fufesou
title: start --server on gmd wayland
body:
1. Start --server on login interface (gdm wayland).
2. Better  detect of display server.
3. Fix potential bugs that prevent the --service from restarting --server.
https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/blob/71d1bacf78a219e13fd5d97b32fb3da78ae7bda7/src/platform/linux.rs#L324

author: fufesou
title: Feat/linux virtual display
body:
1. Linux virual display support. https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/issues/59
2. May fix https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/issues/3592.
3. Reduce the frequency of loginctl calls. https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/issues/3129
4. Refactor dialog. https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/pull/3764#issuecomment-1482636535 @grummbeer 
5. Add "--cm-no-ui" for virtual display. There's some `segfault` bug with "--cm" with ui on headless env.

**Only tested on Ubuntu for now.**

Prerequirements:
```bash
# Only support gnome desktop. https://www.gnome.org
# xfce4 may be supported.

# for Ubuntu
$ sudo apt install ubuntu-desktop
$ sudo apt install xserver-xorg-video-dummy
$ sudo apt install lightdm

# for Fedora
$ sudo sudo yum groups install "GNOME"
$ sudo yum install xorg-x11-drv-dummy

# for archlinux
$ pacman -S xorg xorg-server xf86-video-dummy
$ pacman -S gnome

```

Steps
```
# install rustdesk
# get rustdesk id
$ sudo rustdesk --get-id
# set password
$ sudo rustdesk --password <password>

# connect
```

TODOs:
1. Do not show "Connection Error" on logout.

author: 21pages
title: video data queue for avoid data accumulation
body:
#3572
1. Use the channel to send key frames, use the ring buffer to store other frames, and use the channel to send notification messages.
2. If a key frame is received, the ring buffer is emptied, and when the ring buffer overflows, the oldest frame is discarded.

Problems:
    Every time the video queue overflows, the picture is blurred, but if you switch to other pages and then switch back, it will be clear again. This can happen when playing a video.

author: 21pages
title: audio latency
body:
#534 
There is a latency at the beginning in my test, and it does not increase over time.
The control end don't have enough time to initialize the audio device after receiving the AudioFormat,  so don't send AudioFrame util one second after sending AudioFormat, and it does helps in my test.
If video latency does increase over time, this PR will not help.

https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/blob/81bc362b2b414414b58360f87040749dab8465ab/src/client.rs#L865
data_callback using old data may be the reason.
Input data callback maybe faster than output data callback, which cause increased delay.
https://github.com/RustAudio/cpal/issues/766

author: sabxp
title: Privacy Mode / Blacken Screen Off on Android remote side
body:
I test privacy mode but it didn't work when Android is the remote host.
Screen off an android device while you are connected to this, it would be great to reduce battery consumption and increase privacity.

There is another github project here that have the ability to screen off the Android device screen while you interact with the device from a computer, it's here:
https://github.com/Genymobile/scrcpy

Maybe someone can take some code from this to apply here. If you call "scrcpy -Sw" it opens the Android Device Screen into the computer and blacken the Android's Device screen. You can interact with the android device from the computer and the Android device screen remains blacken or off.

author: grummbeer
title: fix: Warning: Flutter SVG only supports the following formats for `width` and `height` …
body:
When opening the file transfer view, the log is filled with:

```
flutter: Warning: Flutter SVG only supports the following formats for `width` and `height` on the SVG root:
  width="100%"
  width="100em"
  width="100ex"
  width="100px"
  width="100" (where the number will be treated as pixels).
The supplied value (32pt) will be discarded and treated as if it had not been specified.
```

Reason: `width="32pt" height="32pt"`


I am using "https://jakearchibald.github.io/svgomg/" for optimizing the svgs and saw this when using the originals:

|||||
|--|--|--|--|
|![chat-cutted](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/67791701/226103630-dd66b1ab-9170-4d4c-9cab-15349ecdc106.png)|![arrow-cutted](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/67791701/226103631-41bf1595-006a-406b-b321-29fd379c8b28.png)|![dots-cutted](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/67791701/226103628-d88846c3-4099-4936-86ca-c1f189470f76.png)|![dots-cutted-inkscape](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/67791701/226103632-8ace0feb-165f-42da-8d69-65742d9318e9.png)|

### Before: No visual defect detectable

![after](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/67791701/226103540-973c5b70-5434-49c1-867d-dcded5388670.png)

### After:

- No visual defect detectable
- just no more logs
- no longer this "cutted"-thing

![before](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/67791701/226103542-307ced99-6596-4a24-a696-e0736c8fc325.png)

@NicKoehler, since I'm not that expert on SVG, would be cool if you could review and approve this MR … if you can find time of course.

#3652
1. add `View Mode` in display settings
![1678931387809](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14891774/225489023-89522ee0-c60b-43b6-a783-5da2a478830b.png)
2. view mode behaviour:
 * disable keyboard
 * force disable clipboard, hide `Disable Clipboard` checkbox, won't change PeerConfig
 * force disable show remote cursor, hide `Show remote cursor` checkbox, won't change PeerConfig
 * hide keyboard mode icon
 * hide `Insert Ctrl + Alt + Del`,  `Insert Lock`, because they relay on keyEvent
 * Allow all the other
3. when view mode is unchecked, "Disable Clipboard" and "Show remote cursor" are selected in the same state as the configuration file.
4. Remember view mode, and add default setting for first connection.
![1678931861951](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14891774/225490110-dffed65b-27d0-42c1-a36c-6ca6f1d89761.png)

author: fufesou
title: periodicly get cursor pos on conn
body:
https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/issues/3585

If "Show remote cursor" is not checked, "mouse_pos" service has no subscribers.
Then the controlled side cannot detect if local mouse is moved.
There's no way to set local mouse with higher prority.

title: Run some services even no subscribers.
