https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/issues/3585

If "Show remote cursor" is not checked, "mouse_pos" service has no subscribers.
Then the controlled side cannot detect if local mouse is moved.
There's no way to set local mouse with higher prority.

author: chiehw
title: Add test && Define type for keyboard
body:
1. [x11: refactor key down & up](https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/commit/1c03ad34abd7397a95fbc4716be983648056015c): to get error message.
2. [refactor grab loop](https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/commit/9aaac0e3ee316d1eb89b733d62fe67ecee01f29e): to reduce duplication of code. 
3. [Add keyboard test](https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/commit/d39582d9d48bcc68a9bb95e18631875f55d6d132): to simplify test.
4. [Define new type for keyboard](https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/commit/4c400b2660c06c581285512a190001b36499d20f): to support Translate mode.
5. [Add RawKeyEvent to proto](https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/commit/265acb56697ee242eb6b99ebced47a0baebea676): to send more info on keystrokes.

author: Heap-Hop
title: Refactor file manager
body:
split file manager page to 
- FileManagerView(local)
- FileManagerView(remote)
- statusList (jobTable)

Every `FileManagerView` use independent state, in order to avoid lots of 'isLocal', which may cause potential bugs (#3499) and be difficult to maintain.

- [x] refactor desktop file manager page.
- [x] test desktop file manager page and fix bugs.
- [x] refactor mobile file manager page.
- [x] test mobile file manager page and fix bugs.

author: sj6219
title: fix legacy mode
body:
There is bug that an exception occurred inside the TISGetInputSourceProperty function.
https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/blob/de359a731b8440c1703b5245615f20e4c41ad44a/libs/enigo/src/macos/macos_impl.rs#L690
This bug only occurs when operating as a service.
I don't know under what conditions it happens yet, but it happened in the previous version 1.1.9, and it still happens occasionally in the latest nightly version.
For now, it would be better to avoid bugs.

author: NicKoehler
title: peer sorting implementation
body:
I'm not a flutter expert, but I implemented the sorting feature #2948, it probably needs some design improvements, but the feature is here:

- [x] desktop
- [x] mobile
- [x] save user preference once selected
- [x] not visible in "recent sessions"
- [x] rounded tiles
- [x] unify peer view modes in one button
- [x] find better design/positioning

I'm sure there are some improvements to be made. I'm open to any suggestion, feel free to let me know if you need code changes.

| Desktop | Mobile |
| -- | -- |

author: fufesou
title: fix macos strid align
body:
https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/issues/3424

```rust
#[cfg(all(target_os = "macos", feature = "flutter_texture_render"))]
pub const STRIDE_ALIGN: usize = 16;
#[cfg(not(all(target_os = "macos", feature = "flutter_texture_render")))]
pub const STRIDE_ALIGN: usize = 1;
```

author: grummbeer
title: Rework on Mobile (UI). Share Screen
body:
### Fixes

- https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/issues/3262 
- https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/issues/3535
- Wrong buttonstyle on "stop service" dialog

### Changes

- Remove hardcoded colors that prevent the nice look on dark mode
- Remove hardcoded fontfamily
- Move server status to the server info
- Move button "start service" near the "service not running" message that refers to it for quick access
- Add headline "your device" according to desktop "your desktop"
- Rename "Password" to "one-time password" waht it is and according to desktop
- Move connection card up into viewport
- Add "check" icon on "accept" button according to dialogs
- Move action button on connection card to right according to dialogs
- Add "info" icon to "no audio" information
- Reduce alpha for avatar circle in light mode for better contrast
- Remove layout shift, no element "hopping" on switch from connection page to server page.
- Change button text from "close" to "disconnect" for "disconnect" buttons
- Using "PaddingCard.title" also for "Service not running" headline
- Make "PaddingCard.title" follow theme (`textTheme.titleLarge`)
- Replace readonly textinput for ID/password, use "copy to clipboard" instead
- Use switches instead of text buttons for "Permissions" 
   - better look
   - well know concept for user
   - avoid confusing on wording. "open/close system settings" vs. "grant/revoke permission"
- Adjust tip text "or OPEN [Screen capture]" to "or enable [Screen capture]"
 
### service not running 

|before |after|
|-- |-- |
|![service-not-running-audio-before](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/67791701/223979126-68b39d09-1c0c-4a81-b144-c43c59bcf13c.png)|![service-not-running-audio-after](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/67791701/223979133-31fecc97-5c13-47a8-9c51-9afa30b6b9d3.png)|

### dark

|before|after|
|--|--|
|![mobile-server-page-dark-before-1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/67791701/223974197-02b99fe1-5d8d-44a0-8d30-86f06e5c3e0c.png)|![mobile-server-page-dark-after-2-2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/67791701/224087092-da297dd1-51e3-454e-9319-0b35d054e6f8.png)|

### light

|before|after|
|--|--|
|![mobile-server-page-light-before-1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/67791701/223988329-4a30a408-7762-409c-adb4-d0227bf74d47.png)|![mobile-server-page-light-after-2-2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/67791701/224086877-97e31d53-dd6b-4ec5-91f0-1a3076ebc4ec.png))



### layout shift

Switch from connection page to server page.

|-- |-- |

author: Heap-Hop
title: Android start on boot (auto start after reboot)
body:
https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/discussions/1516

- [x] Enable BootReceiver.
- [x] Adapt to Android 12 (ACTION_IGNORE_BATTERY_OPTIMIZATION_SETTINGS, SYSTEM_ALERT_WINDOW).
- [x] add `Start on Boot` setting option.
- [x] Permissions detection before `Start on Boot` is enabled.
- [x] Add start_service and pass app_dir from Android MainService.
- [x] Added UI `Start on Boot`

- Optimized and refactored some Android code.

This event is triggered when the device is booted up from a quick boot mode, which is a feature introduced in Android 5.0 Lollipop that allows devices to boot up faster by skipping certain system initialization steps.

author: seffs
title: fix desktop entry key/values
body:
Similar to #1255 and related to #1299, running `desktop-file-validate /usr/share/applications/rustdesk.desktop` on Ubuntu 22.04 returns the following:  
```
/usr/share/applications/rustdesk.desktop: error: value "1.2.0" for key "Version" in group "Desktop Entry" is not a known version
/usr/share/applications/rustdesk.desktop: error: required key "Exec" in group "Desktop Action new-window" is not present
```
* "Version" refers to the Freedesktop Specification[1], not the program's one. Given that this was correctly defined in `rustdesk-link.desktop`, the same value should be used here too.
* The new-window section is missing the `Exec` key. Ubuntu 22.04 refuses to launch from the Activities overview (apps menu) without this key.  

[1] https://specifications.freedesktop.org/desktop-entry-spec/desktop-entry-spec-latest.html

author: akhildevelops
title: improved devcontainer with Android build support
body:
Hi,

I've improved existing [devcontainer](https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/tree/master/.devcontainer) with [new features](https://github.com/akhildevelops/rustdesk/tree/feature/devcontainer/.devcontainer) that supports local (mac/linux) and android builds in debug and release mode.

Features:
- Automatically builds local binaries in debug mode.
- Generate Android APKs with single command `.devcontainer/build.sh --release android`
- Option to generate debug / release binaries for both local and android
- Installs the dependencies required depending on the target platform. Ex: NDK Tools, Java, C++ libraries
- Creates <root>/flutter/android/key.properties  file for sigining APK builds

---

To use the dev environment, install docker and devcontainers extension in vscode.

Hit `ctrl shift p` for command pallete and hit `devcontainers: reopen in container`

![Screenshot from 2023-02-20 23-42-04](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6951100/220176211-c4a031ee-4d13-430f-8b25-5d431d7d77d5.png)

author: grummbeer
title: Rework on PeerCard menu
body:
### Fixes

- menu item "remove" doesn't remove peer from favorites
- menu showing always "add to favorites" even peer is already a favorite
- menu item "add to addressbook" disappear when clicked

### Changes

- move menu item "remove" to the last menu position, make its destructive role visible, change text to "delete"
- add missing menu item "add/remove favorite" to DiscoveredPeersCard
- hide menu item "add to address book" if not logged in.
- add visually feedback for state of "is favorite" in menu item "add/remove favorite"
- add missing label to Text input on "rename"

---

### Menu item "remove"

The "remove" entry is too close to its siblings is some ways.

|before | after |
|-- |-- |
|![remove-before](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/67791701/219976511-86c73c5f-3b1b-4fb6-b1ac-ba9c05f8dbb8.png)|![remove-after](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/67791701/220903141-278e0097-b190-4e4e-be88-ac68b264b1f1.png)|

### Menu item "Add to favorites" 

"Add favorites" is always shown in menu even if already in favs. 

**Now**:

|peer not in favs | peer in favs |
|-- |-- |
|![favorite-before](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/67791701/219976509-aaf99b7f-e0df-4f11-a3d8-217a622081ac.png)|![favorite-after](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/67791701/219976502-8ad6f2de-d357-4639-b352-27e519e6f530.png)|


#### add visual state indicator (behave like a checkbox)

|peer not in favs | peer in favs |
|-- |-- |
|![favorite-indicator-add](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/67791701/219979396-48c63079-c539-4433-b237-abc2db0ff521.png)|![favorite-indicator-remove](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/67791701/219979397-8324968f-1d39-4dbd-88ae-6dd244ff6580.png)|

unifiy components behavior "Text input with constraints"

- Add visual feedback for the contraints
- validate local contraints first, before making an api call.   

|before|after|
|-- |-- |
|![rustdesk-change-id-message-before](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/67791701/219952506-50bdada0-3539-43ed-a354-c9f54595316d.gif)|![rustdesk-change-id-message-after](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/67791701/219952514-8a2e2403-078a-4425-a228-ae872b8188b0.gif)|

- [x] check wording

- "starts with a-z"  can be ambiguous. Is this meaning **only** lowercase? > "starts with a letter"
- "characters" > "allowed characters"?

longer names are more clear, but are in contrast to the very short messages in password dialog ("digit", "uppercase", "lowercase")

What do you prefer?

author: Kingtous
title: WIP: replace canvas with texture for the better performance of decoding and showing video frame
body:
BREAKING:

This PR does a refactor, which replaces the general canvas with native `Texture` provided by Flutter official.

Benefits:
Remove the time interval between the two messages brought by binary messager and the calling chain. which reduces the processing time from 40ms to <10ms per frame.

Related:

- #3141

author: 21pages
title: force relay when id is suffixed with "/r"
body:
[#1597 ](https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/issues/1597#issuecomment-1427040649)
works only on main window ID InputTextField

- [X] remember it  via "force-always-relay" option, what about addressbook?
     * sync before
- [x] hint dialog, our retry logic has no way to cover all cases, these dialog is our last defense, e.g. connection reset soon after connected without known reason.
     * add hint messagebox, but it's not easy to test it.
     * show hint messagebox when 
        * last_receive_time - success_time < 3 second
        * three times in a row

author: grummbeer
title: fix autofocus
body:
Same behavior as in https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/pull/3145. Using `autofocus: true` according to https://api.flutter.dev/flutter/material/TextField/autofocus.html and https://docs.flutter.dev/cookbook/forms/focus#focus-a-text-field-as-soon-as-its-visible

- dialog permanent password. see #3157,
- dialog RDP settings

![rustdesk-rdp-settings](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/67791701/218262361-a86c79ce-f2e8-4838-a29d-ca29272e3e04.gif)

There are some one-field situations where this effect is not pop up.

- https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/blob/master/flutter/lib/common/widgets/address_book.dart#L389
- https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/blob/master/flutter/lib/common/widgets/dialog.dart#L57
- https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/blob/master/flutter/lib/common/widgets/dialog.dart#L102
- https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/blob/master/flutter/lib/common/widgets/dialog.dart#L189
- https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/blob/master/flutter/lib/common/widgets/peer_card.dart#L644
- https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/blob/master/flutter/lib/desktop/pages/file_manager_page.dart#L801

 The focus is also set right with "autofocus", should these fields also be changed (and included in this PR)?

author: grummbeer
title: Dialog. Adjust padding of the title.
body:
Using the defined padding also for the title for an even alignment. If no title is used, [its top padding](https://api.flutter.dev/flutter/material/SimpleDialog/titlePadding.html) will not apply

before > after
![rustdesk-dialog-title-padding-before-after](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/67791701/218255973-b8ae4601-1a52-4362-ba08-cfddfd06cadd.png)

Note:

The value for the contentPadding can be set by a constructor argument (there is [one call that makes use of it](https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/blob/master/flutter/lib/mobile/widgets/dialog.dart#L156)). This value is apply to the content but not to the title nor action. This can lead to an not nice looking alignment, especially if a title is used and the value is similar or smaller than the default value.

author: akhildevelops
title: devcontainer for vscode
body:
It will help to create a separate development environment in docker. It doesn't pollute the local system with tools and dependencies required for building rustdesktop. Even rustlang need not be installed.  Vscode can be connected to the dev environment container through dev containers extension.

The dockerfile for the dev environment is taken from [https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/blob/master/Dockerfile](https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/blob/master/Dockerfile) of the repo.

Pre-requisites:
- docker
- dev containers vscode extension

Open command pallete by pressing `ctrl+shift+p`and then goto `Dev Containers: Reopen in Container`. A new workspace will be opened that creates, installs required dependencies and runs dev environment. The vscode terminal points to container. It will also download and enable extensions such as lldb, rust-analyzer.

author: 21pages
title: Fix elevation
body:
1. fix different flink in two processes.
2. filter foreground window to avoid frequent elevation prompts
3. fix cm push_event

`consent.exe`,  which is used to identify whether UAC is running, may run until it's killed in taskMgr in special case, and that causes elevation prompt at start up without any UAC or foreground elevation window.

author: simonspa
title: Remove wayland fix for good
body:
This pull completely removes the possibility of overriding the GDM3 settings to disable Wayland. Reasons:

* Wayland support is currently being added (see e.g. #932 #2360 and others)
* This possibility has previously been deactivated (see ad2210106722267130e94b1be2a234b59e8ba305) but has crept back in later
* System settings should not be altered from a 3rdparty program without clearly stating *what* is being changed.
* It is questionable if this should ever have been here in the first place...

author: 4JX
title: hbb_common: Use OUT_DIR in build.rs
body:
Using the `scrap` fork in a project, and thus `hbb_common`. Had issues compiling on NixOS with [`crane`](https://github.com/ipetkov/crane).

As per a discussion there, `src` should ideally be left untouched, and all generated items need to come from `OUT_DIR`.

author: botanicvelious
title: Bump LLVM ver and enable i686
body:
Currently LLVM 10 is being used, it has some issues with rust compile times as there was a pretty big compile regression between LLVM 9 and 10. Bumped to the latest LLVM 15 as it is supported on rust as of about October, builds seem to work fine with it after testing. Build time is up to about 17% faster with LLVM 15.

Also enabled i686-pc-windows-msvc builds, the nightly release was missing i686 for windows.

Lastly removed the double install of Rust toolchain in the same process

author: botanicvelious
title: Allow setting custom server and key with env variables
body:
1. Code edited to allow the setting of a custom server with env variables

RENDEZVOUS_SERVER1
RENDEZVOUS_SERVER2
RENDEZVOUS_SERVER3

2. Allows editing custom key with 

RS_PUB_KEY_VAL

3. Workflows updated to support adding these custom env variables via secrets.

4. Workflows updated to allow ignoring key signing if specific secrets are set.

5. Interface file checks hbb_common::config::RS_PUB_KEY to decide if to display "run your own server" message rather then the existence of custom-rendezvous-server

6. Added flutter-custom-build.yml so that people can use github workflows to generate there own files using github actions

author: st0nie
title: fix session type when starting wayland via tty
body:
#87 might solve this issue
In the original code, if you start the wayland compositor via tty, your rustdesk will think you are using tty, and if you read XDG_SESSION_TYPE once while using tty, then if you are really using tty, "display_server" will still be tty, and if If the wayland compositor is used, then it will return wayland
```
dm -> xorg x11
dm -> wayland wayland
dm -> tty tty
tty -> tty tty
tty -> xorg x11
tty -> wayland tty
```

author: amyipdev
title: remove unnecessary allow block
body:
Patch #2701 (609117c: "ignore style warnings in libs/scrap") was merged, but the RustDesk team decided to later instead changed is_cursor_embedded to uppercase (see discussion on the PR), thus no longer triggering the warning and no longer needing the allow block. This was changed in (b723f84: "fix linux to mac, keyboard input"). This patch removes the now unnecessary allowances.

Signed-off-by: Amy Parker <apark0006@student.cerritos.edu>
Cc: fufseou <shuanglongchen@yeah.net>

author: Kingtous
title: feat: add macos p12 codesign for nightly build (mac osx sign)
body:
These secrets need to be configured first:

- MACOS_P12_BASE64
- MACOS_P12_PASSWORD
- MACOS_CODESIGN_IDENTITY
- MACOS_NOTARIZE_JSON (base64)
    - related: https://gregoryszorc.com/docs/apple-codesign/stable/apple_codesign_getting_started.html#apple-codesign-app-store-connect-api-key

identity eg:
```
$ security find-identity -v
  1) ABCDABCDABCD "Apple Development: my@email.com (CODE)"
     1 valid identities found
```
so `MACOS_CODESIGN_IDENTITY` is `"Apple Development: my@email.com (CODE)"`. Note that the double quote should be included in the secret.

author: amyipdev
title: ignore style warnings in libs/scrap
body:
Constant `is_cursor_embedded` does not follow the Rust standard stylistic convention of upper-case global variables and constants. This causes two warnings to be thrown when compiling (tested on Arch Linux, commit = 68fda34, Rust = 1.66.0), one each for the Wayland and X11 common modules. Since these variables are not new, their names should not be modified; to remove the warnings, this patch allows non-style-conforming names on these two constant declarations specifically, suppressing the warnings. It does not affect stylistic warnings on any other code within the project.

Signed-off-by: Amy Parker <apark0006@student.cerritos.edu>
Cc: fufesou <shuanglongchen@yeah.net>

author: Kingtous
title: opt: allows handle key events by rdev with mouse moves to outside of window
body:
This PR allows to press the combinations or the key like:
- Alt + Tab
- Win, etc.

whenever the mouse is inside or outside of window.

Solution:
- reuse key focus event.
- add a multi window listener to cancel the key focus, when the user is operating all the other windows.

author: toriato
title: Implement RGB0 pixel format
body:
Most of the implementation code was taken from the [H-M-H/Weylus](https://github.com/H-M-H/Weylus). While it appears that there may be a licensing conflict, according to a previous response from the maintainer, it seems that there are no problems with using the code, so I used it. https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/issues/56#issuecomment-882727967

also please note that I have not used Rust before, so the code may be incorrect. However, when I tested and ran it, there were no issues. I apologize for the inconvenience, but please check the code again before merging. Thank you.

Related issues and commits: 
- https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/issues/2608
- https://github.com/H-M-H/Weylus/issues/155#issuecomment-1120327869
- https://github.com/H-M-H/Weylus/commit/55301e05416171afb359fe9580b7038f22038f9d
- https://github.com/H-M-H/Weylus/commit/d399fb4864c25438639e4c01b1be5d823df1aaa3

author: Kingtous
title: feat: add windows sign config
body:
This PR adds a sign config for windows.

The following secrets must be set:

- WINDOWS_PFX_BASE64 
    -  via `certutil -encode .\CERT.pfx .\CERT.base64.txt`, copy base64 code **WITHOUT** `===begin xxx ===` and `===end xxx===`
- WINDOWS_PFX_PASSWORD 
- WINDOWS_PFX_SHA1_THUMBPRINT
    - via `Get-PfxCertificate -FilePath .\CERT.pfx` in powershell.

author: Kingtous
title: opt: use secret to sign android apk
body:
need to set following secrets:

- ALIAS
- KEY_PASSWORD
- KEY_STORE_PASSWORD
- SIGNING_KEY

`SIGNING_KEY` can be acquired by `openssl base64 < KEYSTORE.jks | tr -d '\n' | tee KEYSTORE.jks.base64.txt`

reference: https://github.com/marketplace/actions/sign-android-release

author: Kingtous
title: opt: use flutter-elinux 3.0.5 for arm64
body:
currently 3.0.5 does not have official arm64 engine/toolchain. flutter-elinux backport it to 2.x, make arm64 able to easily build without compiling engine/flutter by ourselves. 

note that we only use the arm64 linux artifact from flutter elinux, not elinux ones revised by their team.

author: Kingtous
title: fix: flatpak x86_64 artifact name
body:
This PR provide a quick fix for downloading artifact to build flatpak on x86_64.

Note:
We build all artifacts on qemu ubuntu18.04. So `os` in matrix job is just for naming artifacts now. And the reason why we use ubuntu-20.04 host is for a better performance with prebuilt qemu 3.x. In the prior step,  we use ubuntu-18.04 for naming, so flatpak should be configured too.

author: Kingtous
title: feat: add aarch64 rustdesk nightly build
body:
This PR introduces arm64 artifacts of rustdesk flutter nightly build.

Provides:
- rustdesk for flutter - aarch64 deb package
- rustdesk for flutter - aarch64 rpm package

arch .tar.zst needs to be packaged on arm archlinux, which is not supported by `run-on-arch-action` yet.

Features:
- parallel some steps and cache to boost build process.
- split some steps to fit multi platform compilation.
- split x86_64, arm64 build process, if arm64 build fails, x86_64 will have no influence.

Next milestone of nightly ci:
- introduce arm build.

Note:
The first time of aarch64 will cause a few hours. After the cache being generated, it will cause 1-1.5 hours on average for arm build.

Related: #853

There is there mode:

note:
1. If 1.1.9 connect to 1.2.0, 1.2.0 is click accpet only, the password box will still be displayed first, then it will show logining in until click.

title: quick start portable ci
body:
1. Add quick start portable ci. QuickStart will request elevation at startup, and run portable service all the time.
2. Fix cleanup shared memory, at_exit() will not be called on flutter , clean it on window close callback.

to-do:
1. It will take more time to shutdown the app. If it is started immediately after closing, the previous process has not ended, and there will be problems such as not going online and random passwords not being displayed. It's happened when portable service process is running, maybe the main program ipc-server needs to be optimized.

author: biberino
title: Use "_" instead of ":" in PeerConfig filenames
body:
Windows doesn't allow ":" in filenames, thats why connections to peers with the portnumer (<ip>:<port>) dont remember the password nor appear in recent sessions.

PeerConfig files on *nix containing ":" will be renamed on the first run to stay backward compatible.

This fixes #1730

Move all configs of flutter into rust.
1. Local config of flutter ui. eg: window size, canvas info.
2. Peer config of flutter ui (in each peer config file). eg: Pin remote menu bar.
3. Common local config like "theme", "lang".

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13586388/201152752-c68c8671-1b76-4baf-9131-4e5d13fe2bcf.png)


Android building is not tested.

author: 21pages
title: portable service
body:
Run seperate screen capture process(portable service) when click elevate on cm window for uac and elevated forground window.
1. Main processand separate process, exchange data through shared memory, synchronize data with read/write counters, there is four kind of data, 
* capture
* cursor-info
* key
* mouse
2. Whether or not to elevate is entirely up to the controlled end

# to-do
1. ~UAC confirmation timeout is uncertain, exchange ipc server/client~
2. ~Optimize sciter cm ui~
3. ~Flutter cm buttons displayed abnormally on release version~ (not return Expanded)
4. ~Check missing mouse_pos service~ (behavior is same between user and system)
5. ~better prompt~
6. Do more check on shared-memory, use same share memory file all the time if possible, figure out [allow_raw](https://github.com/elast0ny/shared_memory/blob/344a5c410eadb2018f1c4bf5f7c23b8ab2f88089/src/windows.rs#L18) option
7. Do more check on synchronization of state transitions
8. ~Figure out whether dxgi is usable, if usable, try dxgi before gdi~

author: 64kramsystem
title: hbb_common: Fix CONFIG locks unintentionally not acquired
body:
Variables defined as `_` only are released immediately; see compile error:

    error: non-binding let on a synchronization lock
      --> libs/hbb_common/src/config.rs:798:13
        |
    798 |         let _ = CONFIG.read().unwrap(); // for lock
        |             ^   ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ this binding will immediately drop the value assigned to it
        |             |
        |             this lock is not assigned to a binding and is immediately dropped
        |
        = note: `#[deny(let_underscore_lock)]` on by default

By appending a phony suffix to the variable name, the lock stays in scope.

author: Zinal001
title: Command-Line Improvements
body:
Reworked the whole command-line handling in core_main.rs. It can now handle multiple arguments on the same call.

Also added two new commands: `--set-*` for setting most configurations in RustDesk2.toml _(Excluding nat_type, serial and local-ip-addr)_.

The `--set-*` commands verifies and saves the values into _RustDesk2.toml_.
To allow for the `--set-*` commands to be used with the `--install` command, it also saves both configuration files into cached files _(\_RustDesk.toml and \_RustDesk2.toml)_ which is read by the program on startup _(If they exists)_ and overwrites any configuration in the main files _(In the %appdata% folder on windows, for example)_.

These commands should be at least a partial solution to unattended installations.
Command-lines like this is now possible: `rustdesk --password PASS --set-relay-server RELAY-SERVER --set-custom-rendezvous-server ID-SERVER --set-verification-method use-permanent-password --set-allow-darktheme Y --install`

The other command is `--exit`, which exits the program. This is useful now since command such as `--password` will no longer automatically exit the program when done. _(Commands such as `--install` **will** exit them like before)_.

author: fufesou
title: Test fix wayland
body:
1. Fix build.py on flutter and sciter version.
2. Add new message box type. (proto)
3. Message box support link view.
4. Fix crash on wayland.
5. Better prompt on wayland support.
6. Remove user service. Instead use "--service" to manage "--server"(run_as_user) on Wayland.
7. Get active uid and usertime by one funtion call.

TODOs:
1. Wayland. cm UI not fit well (sciter-wayland version). 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13586388/196224774-02583d2b-7a0a-4ca8-ae31-ced17a5072de.png)
2. Wayland. "Lock Screen" is unsupported now. After Locking and Unlokcing, the pictures is ok, but input is not ok. 
3. If connection is established before "--cm" UI is ready, cm UI shows "Waiting for new connection ...".
4. Wayland. Better way to stop "--server" process which is created by "run_as_user".

author: sandr01d
title: Fix detection of display server inside flatpak
body: Fixes detection of running display server when running as flatpak by using `flatpak-spawn` as [discussed](https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/discussions/1537#discussioncomment-3854473). I've added a flatpak feature to hbb_common that has to be enabled when building for flatpak. With this PR it is possible to connect to a machine that is running rustdesk inside a flatpak as long as rustdesk is opened.

author: fufesou
title: Ipv6
body:
https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk-server/pull/119

## Not Sure
1. Why not [drop socket](https://github.com/fufesou/rustdesk/blob/5a9d8545d801b6038acca6c97def9487a4361809/src/server.rs#L86) earlier?
2. If `rendezvous_addr` is a domain string. [`register_pk`](https://github.com/fufesou/rustdesk/blob/5a9d8545d801b6038acca6c97def9487a4361809/src/rendezvous_mediator.rs#L459) use [domain url](https://github.com/fufesou/rustdesk/blob/5a9d8545d801b6038acca6c97def9487a4361809/src/rendezvous_mediator.rs#L153)  to send a udp request. The rendezvous server may see an IPv6 or IPv4 address by occasionally.
  It may be caused by my cloud network provider.
  But it won't take any problems. The only result is from IPv6 --> IPv6 to IPv4 --> IPv4.
3. Comment the [checking socket addr](https://github.com/fufesou/rustdesk/blob/5a9d8545d801b6038acca6c97def9487a4361809/src/rendezvous_mediator.rs#L379) logic.

## Known issues
1. Some private IPv6 is an one-way link. Only relay connection be established on those cases.
2. No considerations about multiple network interfaces.
3. Socks proxy does not support IPv6.

author: 21pages
title: video record
body:
#### Features:
* Implemented:
1. Recording manually on the control end.
2. Optional recording automatically on the controlled end. 
3. Customize save directory
4. Support change codec
5. Support switch display
6. Permission
* Not implemented:
1. Optional recording automatically on the controll end.
2. ~Flutter switch display during recording~ 
3. Check free disk space 

#### Problems:
1. ~~Can't flush to the file during recording~~
2. ~~Playing time is inaccurate~~
3. More than one file of one recording on the conotrolled end.
4. ~265 not tested~
5. ~Sometimes can't play~ (server write file tail)
7. Sometimes strange sound during recording

author: dependabot[bot]
title: Bump winit from 0.26.1 to 0.27.3
body:
Bumps [winit](https://github.com/rust-windowing/winit) from 0.26.1 to 0.27.3.
Release notes

Sourced from winit's releases.

Winit Version v0.27.3

  • On Windows, added WindowExtWindows::set_undecorated_shadow and WindowBuilderExtWindows::with_undecorated_shadow to draw the drop shadow behind a borderless window.
  • On Windows, fixed default window features (ie snap, animations, shake, etc.) when decorations are disabled.
  • On Windows, fixed ALT+Space shortcut to open window menu.
  • On Wayland, fixed Ime::Preedit not being sent on IME reset.
  • Fixed unbound version specified for raw-window-handle leading to compilation failures.
  • Empty Ime::Preedit event will be sent before Ime::Commit to help clearing preedit.
  • On X11, fixed IME context picking by querying for supported styles beforehand.

Winit Version v0.27.2

  • On macOS, fixed touch phase reporting when scrolling.
  • On X11, fix min, max and resize increment hints not persisting for resizable windows (e.g. on DPI change).
  • On Windows, respect min/max inner sizes when creating the window.
  • For backwards compatibility, Window now (additionally) implements the old version (0.4) of the HasRawWindowHandle trait
  • On Windows, added support for EventLoopWindowTarget::set_device_event_filter.
  • On Wayland, fix user requested WindowEvent::RedrawRequested being delayed by a frame.

Winit Version v0.27.1

  • The minimum supported Rust version was lowered to 1.57.0 and now explicitly tested.
  • On X11, fix crash on start due to inability to create an IME context without any preedit.

Winit Version v0.27.0

  • On Windows, fix hiding a maximized window.
  • On Android, ndk-glue's NativeWindow lock is now held between Event::Resumed and Event::Suspended.
  • On Web, added EventLoopExtWebSys with a spawn method to start the event loop without throwing an exception.
  • Added WindowEvent::Occluded(bool), currently implemented on macOS and X11.
  • On X11, fix events for caps lock key not being sent
  • Build docs on docs.rs for iOS and Android as well.
  • Breaking: Removed the WindowAttributes struct, since all its functionality is accessible from WindowBuilder.
  • Added WindowBuilder::transparent getter to check if the user set transparent attribute.
  • On macOS, Fix emitting Event::LoopDestroyed on CMD+Q.
  • On macOS, fixed an issue where having multiple windows would prevent run_return from ever returning.
  • On Wayland, fix bug where the cursor wouldn't hide in GNOME.
  • On macOS, Windows, and Wayland, add set_cursor_hittest to let the window ignore mouse events.
  • On Windows, added WindowExtWindows::set_skip_taskbar and WindowBuilderExtWindows::with_skip_taskbar.
  • On Windows, added EventLoopBuilderExtWindows::with_msg_hook.
  • On Windows, remove internally unique DC per window.
  • On macOS, remove the need to call set_ime_position after moving the window.
  • Added Window::is_visible.
  • Added Window::is_resizable.
  • Added Window::is_decorated.
  • On X11, fix for repeated event loop iteration when ControlFlow was Wait
  • On X11, fix scale factor calculation when the only monitor is reconnected
  • On Wayland, report unaccelerated mouse deltas in DeviceEvent::MouseMotion.
  • On Web, a focused event is manually generated when a click occurs to emulate behaviour of other backends.
  • Breaking: Bump ndk version to 0.6, ndk-sys to v0.3, ndk-glue to 0.6.
  • Remove no longer needed WINIT_LINK_COLORSYNC environment variable.
  • Breaking: Rename the Exit variant of ControlFlow to ExitWithCode, which holds a value to control the exit code after running. Add an Exit constant which aliases to ExitWithCode(0) instead to avoid major breakage. This shouldn't affect most existing programs.
  • Add EventLoopBuilder, which allows you to create and tweak the settings of an event loop before creating it.
  • Deprecated EventLoop::with_user_event; use EventLoopBuilder::with_user_event instead.

... (truncated)

Changelog

Sourced from winit's changelog.

0.27.3

  • On Windows, added WindowExtWindows::set_undecorated_shadow and WindowBuilderExtWindows::with_undecorated_shadow to draw the drop shadow behind a borderless window.
  • On Windows, fixed default window features (ie snap, animations, shake, etc.) when decorations are disabled.
  • On Windows, fixed ALT+Space shortcut to open window menu.
  • On Wayland, fixed Ime::Preedit not being sent on IME reset.
  • Fixed unbound version specified for raw-window-handle leading to compilation failures.
  • Empty Ime::Preedit event will be sent before Ime::Commit to help clearing preedit.
  • On X11, fixed IME context picking by querying for supported styles beforehand.

0.27.2 (2022-8-12)

  • On macOS, fixed touch phase reporting when scrolling.
  • On X11, fix min, max and resize increment hints not persisting for resizable windows (e.g. on DPI change).
  • On Windows, respect min/max inner sizes when creating the window.
  • For backwards compatibility, Window now (additionally) implements the old version (0.4) of the HasRawWindowHandle trait
  • On Windows, added support for EventLoopWindowTarget::set_device_event_filter.
  • On Wayland, fix user requested WindowEvent::RedrawRequested being delayed by a frame.

0.27.1 (2022-07-30)

  • The minimum supported Rust version was lowered to 1.57.0 and now explicitly tested.
  • On X11, fix crash on start due to inability to create an IME context without any preedit.

0.27.0 (2022-07-26)

  • On Windows, fix hiding a maximized window.
  • On Android, ndk-glue's NativeWindow lock is now held between Event::Resumed and Event::Suspended.
  • On Web, added EventLoopExtWebSys with a spawn method to start the event loop without throwing an exception.
  • Added WindowEvent::Occluded(bool), currently implemented on macOS and X11.
  • On X11, fix events for caps lock key not being sent
  • Build docs on docs.rs for iOS and Android as well.
  • Breaking: Removed the WindowAttributes struct, since all its functionality is accessible from WindowBuilder.
  • Added WindowBuilder::transparent getter to check if the user set transparent attribute.
  • On macOS, Fix emitting Event::LoopDestroyed on CMD+Q.
  • On macOS, fixed an issue where having multiple windows would prevent run_return from ever returning.
  • On Wayland, fix bug where the cursor wouldn't hide in GNOME.
  • On macOS, Windows, and Wayland, add set_cursor_hittest to let the window ignore mouse events.
  • On Windows, added WindowExtWindows::set_skip_taskbar and WindowBuilderExtWindows::with_skip_taskbar.
  • On Windows, added EventLoopBuilderExtWindows::with_msg_hook.
  • On Windows, remove internally unique DC per window.
  • On macOS, remove the need to call set_ime_position after moving the window.
  • Added Window::is_visible.
  • Added Window::is_resizable.
  • Added Window::is_decorated.
  • On X11, fix for repeated event loop iteration when ControlFlow was Wait
  • On X11, fix scale factor calculation when the only monitor is reconnected
  • On Wayland, report unaccelerated mouse deltas in DeviceEvent::MouseMotion.
  • On Web, a focused event is manually generated when a click occurs to emulate behaviour of other backends.
  • Breaking: Bump ndk version to 0.6, ndk-sys to v0.3, ndk-glue to 0.6.

... (truncated)

Commits
  • adfa5bd Release 0.27.3 version
  • 66319c5 On X11 query for XIM styles before creating IME
  • f1470d1 Send empty Ime::Preedit before the Ime::Commit
  • 79dc6bf Remove automatic publish script
  • ad0520e Specify minimum supported version for RWH 0.4
  • 156fa37 Clear preedit if there is no pending preedit on Wayland
  • 2a2733b Revert "ci: manually point ANDROID_NDK_ROOT to latest supplied version"
  • 7af1163 iOS: Fix a few instances of UB (#2428)
  • 229dbff Windows: Update handling of system keypresses (#2445)
  • a5457b2 Document WindowEvent::Moved OS support (#2442)
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

author: dependabot[bot]
title: Bump toggle_switch from 1.4.0 to 2.0.1 in /flutter
body:
Bumps [toggle_switch](https://github.com/PramodJoshi/toggle_switch) from 1.4.0 to 2.0.1.
Release notes

Sourced from toggle_switch's releases.

v2.0.1

  • Added vertical toggle switch option (PR 51):
    • parameter:
      • isVertical (type bool - default false)
  • Added active borders option (Partial implementation from PR 53):
    • parameter:
      • activeBorders (optional, type List)
    • list with only one Border value will apply that Border to all the active switches
    • different Border values can be provided for different switches
  • Added divider margin option:
    • parameter:
      • dividerMargin (optional, type double - default 8.0)
  • Made totalSwitches parameter optional.
  • Added new changes to customTextStyles:
    • list with only one TextStyle value will apply that TextStyle to all the active switches
  • Added new changes to customWidths:
    • customWidths can now reflect widths greater than device width
    • must use horizontal scroll view to prevent overflow
Changelog

Sourced from toggle_switch's changelog.

2.0.1

  • Added vertical toggle switch option (PR 51):
    • parameter:
      • isVertical (type bool - default false)
  • Added active borders option (Partial implementation from PR 53):
    • parameter:
      • activeBorders (optional, type List)
    • list with only one Border value will apply that Border to all the active switches
    • different Border values can be provided for different switches
  • Added divider margin option:
    • parameter:
      • dividerMargin (optional, type double - default 8.0)
  • Made totalSwitches parameter optional.
  • Added new changes to customTextStyles:
    • list with only one TextStyle value will apply that TextStyle to all the active switches
  • Added new changes to customWidths:
    • customWidths can now reflect widths greater than device width
    • must use horizontal scroll view to prevent overflow

author: dependabot[bot]
title: Bump serde_with from 1.14.0 to 2.0.0
body:
Bumps [serde_with](https://github.com/jonasbb/serde_with) from 1.14.0 to 2.0.0.
Release notes

Sourced from serde_with's releases.

serde_with_macros v2.0.0

No changes compared to v2.0.0-rc.0.

Changed

  • Make #[serde_as] behave more intuitive on Option<T> fields.

    The #[serde_as] macro now detects if a #[serde_as(as = "Option<S>")] is used on a field of type Option<T> and applies #[serde(default)] to the field. This restores the ability to deserialize with missing fields and fixes a common annoyance (#183, #185, #311, #417). This is a breaking change, since now deserialization will pass where it did not before and this might be undesired.

    The Option field and transformation are detected by directly matching on the type name. These variants are detected as Option.

    • Option
    • std::option::Option, with or without leading ::
    • core::option::Option, with or without leading ::

    If an existing default attribute is detected, the attribute is not applied again. This behavior can be supressed by using #[serde_as(no_default)] or #[serde_as(as = "Option<S>", no_default)].

Fixed

  • Make the documentation clearer by stating that the #[serde_as] and #[skip_serializing_none] attributes must always be placed before #[derive].

serde_with v2.0.0

Added

  • Make JsonString<T> smarter by allowing nesting serde_as definitions. This allows applying custom serialization logic, before the value gets converted into a JSON string.

    // Rust
#[serde_as(as = "JsonString<Vec<(JsonString, _)>>")]
value: BTreeMap<[u8; 2], u32>,

    // JSON
{"value":"[["[1,2]",3],["[4,5]",6]]"}

Changed

  • Make #[serde_as] behave more intuitive on Option<T> fields.

    The #[serde_as] macro now detects if a #[serde_as(as = "Option<S>")] is used on a field of type Option<T> and applies #[serde(default)] to the field. This restores the ability to deserialize with missing fields and fixes a common annoyance (#183, #185, #311, #417). This is a breaking change, since now deserialization will pass where it did not before and this might be undesired.

    The Option field and transformation are detected by directly matching on the type name. These variants are detected as Option.

    • Option

... (truncated)

Commits

  • 427b025 Bump versions to release v2.0.0
  • 8ad35a0 Merge #490
  • b1190c0 Cleanup links and attributes
  • 12cd92a Merge #489
  • 0534f80 Suppress issue with clippy::explicit_auto_deref
  • 49ebe72 Merge #487
  • 69ed4a1 Make the JsonString smarter
  • 6969abf Merge #484
  • 9c2923e Bump versions to v2.0.0-rc.0
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

author: dependabot[bot]
title: Bump hound from 3.4.0 to 3.5.0
body:
Bumps [hound](https://github.com/ruuda/hound) from 3.4.0 to 3.5.0.
Changelog

Sourced from hound's changelog.

3.5.0

Release date 2022-09-09.

This is a maintenance release that includes most of the bugfixes and features that have been contributed since 3.4.0, which could be cherry-picked on top of 3.4.0. Some other contributions with more far-reaching changes remain unreleased as of yet.

Compatibility:

  • Ensures compatibility with Rust 1.16 through 1.63 stable. Previously the minimum supported Rust version was 1.4. Cargo from 1.4 is no longer compatible with the current crates.io registry, and Rustup fails signature verification for these binaries, so it is infeasible to continue to support it.

New features:

  • Add support for S24_LE files, which store 24 bits in 4 bytes (#4040, #4141)
  • Add WavWriter::new_with_spec_ex (#4242)
  • Add WavSpec::into_header_for_infinite_file (#3333, #3636)

Bugfixes and compatibility improvements:

  • Handle files that have the wValidBitsPerSample field set to zero (#5050, #5151)
  • Avoid overflow in the channel mask when writing file with more than 32 channels (#5959, #6060)

Many thanks to Diffuse, Fletcher Woodruff, Matt Wilkinson, Vitaly Vi Shukela, and Tuckerrrrrrrrrr for contributing to this release.

Commits

author: dependabot[bot]
title: Bump actions/checkout from 2 to 3
body:
Bumps [actions/checkout](https://github.com/actions/checkout) from 2 to 3.
Release notes

Sourced from actions/checkout's releases.

v3.0.0

  • Updated to the node16 runtime by default
    • This requires a minimum Actions Runner version of v2.285.0 to run, which is by default available in GHES 3.4 or later.

v2.4.2

What's Changed

  • Add set-safe-directory input to allow customers to take control. (#770) by @​TingluoHuang in actions/checkout#776
  • Prepare changelog for v2.4.2. by @​TingluoHuang in actions/checkout#778

Full Changelog: https://github.com/actions/checkout/compare/v2...v2.4.2

v2.4.1

  • Fixed an issue where checkout failed to run in container jobs due to the new git setting safe.directory

v2.4.0

  • Convert SSH URLs like org-<ORG_ID>@github.com: to https://github.com/ - pr

v2.3.5

Update dependencies

v2.3.4

  • Add missing awaits
  • Swap to Environment Files

v2.3.3

  • Remove Unneeded commit information from build logs
  • Add Licensed to verify third party dependencies

v2.3.2

Add Third Party License Information to Dist Files

v2.3.1

Fix default branch resolution for .wiki and when using SSH

v2.3.0

Fallback to the default branch

v2.2.0

Fetch all history for all tags and branches when fetch-depth=0

v2.1.1

Changes to support GHES (here and here)

v2.1.0

  • Group output
  • Changes to support GHES alpha release
  • Persist core.sshCommand for submodules
  • Add support ssh
  • Convert submodule SSH URL to HTTPS, when not using SSH

... (truncated)

Changelog

Sourced from actions/checkout's changelog.

Changelog

v3.0.2

  • Add input set-safe-directory

v3.0.1

  • Fixed an issue where checkout failed to run in container jobs due to the new git setting safe.directory
  • Bumped various npm package versions

v3.0.0

  • Update to node 16

v2.3.1

  • Fix default branch resolution for .wiki and when using SSH

v2.3.0

  • Fallback to the default branch

v2.2.0

  • Fetch all history for all tags and branches when fetch-depth=0

v2.1.1

  • Changes to support GHES (here and here)

v2.1.0

  • Group output
  • Changes to support GHES alpha release
  • Persist core.sshCommand for submodules
  • Add support ssh
  • Convert submodule SSH URL to HTTPS, when not using SSH
  • Add submodule support
  • Follow proxy settings
  • Fix ref for pr closed event when a pr is merged
  • Fix issue checking detached when git less than 2.22

v2.0.0

  • Do not pass cred on command line
  • Add input persist-credentials
  • Fallback to REST API to download repo

author: songwei163
title: fix m1 pro scrap compile error
body:
When I first compiled RustDesk on Mac Book M1 Pro. The libvpx header file cannot be found while compiling scrap lib.
The specific error information is as follows：
```
Caused by:
  process didn't exit successfully: `/Users/songwei/work/rustdesk/target/debug/build/scrap-5dd93ef048b3ac32/build-script-build` (exit status: 101)
  --- stdout
  cargo:info=x64-osx
  cargo:rustc-link-lib=static=yuv
  cargo:rustc-link-search=/Users/songwei/vcpkg/installed/x64-osx/lib
  cargo:include=/Users/songwei/vcpkg/installed/x64-osx/include
  cargo:info=x64-osx
  cargo:rustc-link-lib=static=vpx
  cargo:rustc-link-search=/Users/songwei/vcpkg/installed/x64-osx/lib
  cargo:include=/Users/songwei/vcpkg/installed/x64-osx/include
  rerun-if-changed=/Users/songwei/work/rustdesk/libs/scrap/vpx_ffi.h
  rerun-if-changed=/Users/songwei/vcpkg/installed/x64-osx/include

  --- stderr
  /Users/songwei/work/rustdesk/libs/scrap/vpx_ffi.h:1:10: fatal error: 'vpx/vp8.h' file not found
  /Users/songwei/work/rustdesk/libs/scrap/vpx_ffi.h:1:10: fatal error: 'vpx/vp8.h' file not found, err: true
  thread 'main' panicked at 'called `Result::unwrap()` on an `Err` value: ()', libs/scrap/build.rs:128:18
  note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace
```
Through my careful observation,`target os` and `link directory` were found to be incorrect.When installing Library via VCPKG on M1 Pro, the correct path is as follows: `~/vcpkg/installed/arm64-osx`, not `~/vcpkg/installed/x64-osx`.
The end result is this：
```
$ cargo build
   Compiling scrap v0.5.0 (/Users/songwei/work/rustdesk/libs/scrap)
    Finished dev [unoptimized + debuginfo] target(s) in 2.64s
```
I successfully ran RustDesk on Mac Book M1 Pro.So I am honored and happy to find and solve this problem, and hope to help the RustDesk community.

This PR adds the following features:

+ Get current ID via command line
  + Note: `println!` does not work for no-console mode under Windows, i.e. `#![windows_subsystem = "windows"]`. See https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/67159#issuecomment-563014833. This also explains why `./rustdesk.exe --version` shows nothing.
+ Set ID via command line

### Example Usage

```shell
$ ./rustdesk.exe --id 119206784
```

Result:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24671280/188835638-659906ef-0a83-4b65-8a9c-e6ff3778dda2.png)

title: Update AppImageBuilder.yml
body:
included libc6:amd64 which contains /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libnsl.so.1

Should fix the libnsl.sl.1 error when starting the AppImage: 
/tmp/.mount_RustDeJm6xZn//usr/bin/rustdesk: error while loading shared libraries: libnsl.so.1: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory

author: jkhsjdhjs
title: fix desktop entry categories
body:
The category "Other" isn't a valid category [1] and causes unwanted
behavior on some DE's [2]. Thus I remove this category and add the
main category "Network" instead. I also add the additional categories
"RemoteAccess", since rustdesk is a tool to remotely access computers,
and "GTK", because it's based on GTK libraries.

[1] https://specifications.freedesktop.org/menu-spec/latest/apa.html
[2] https://aur.archlinux.org/packages/rustdesk-bin#comment-877405

author: paspo
title: Url link
body:
Support for rustdesk: type links. E.g.    rustdesk:123456789
When you click this link, it should open rustdesk and start a connection.

At the moment, I have linux support and I'm working on windows/osx.

This also fixes a misused `Version` key in `rustdesk.desktop` file.

author: chiehw
title: Feat: Support new keyboard mode
body:
# Context

Simulate keyboard input according to the keycode of the target machine, which is generated by the client.

# Changelog

- Convert to the keycode of the target machine after getting the keyboard event.
- Use keycode to simulate input.

# Test

- Windows
- Linux
- Mac

# Schedule

- [x] Convert to keycode of remote system.
- [x] Simulate with keycode.
- [x] Sync CapsLock and NumLock status.
- [x] Auto release key(move out of windows).
- [x] Linux/Mac->Windows: Arrow key in numpad.
- [x] Compatible with legacy mode.
- [x] switching keyboard mode by UI
- [x] Support translate mode
- [x] Support new keyboard mode in flutter.

author: 21pages
title: password encryption
body:
1. Add security password, onetime password (a special case of random password).
* Default setting:
  * security password: enable
  * random password: enable
  * one-time password: disable
* Old version password -> security password.
* When will new random password automatically generated:
	* Program start
	* Enable random password
	* Activate one-time password
	* It is set to update after session
* The one-time password is invalid only after it is used.
* For operation to random password after session,  password type is not distinguished.


2. Crypt security/peer/peer-rdp/peer-os/socks5 password.
* Symmetric encryption, key:
   * PC: machine uid
   * Mobile: secret key
* The first two characters are used as version when store. 
* If encryption or decryption fails, the original string is returned.


3. Free password authentication for reconnection within 30 seconds and with same remote window
* 30s is from last-receive-time to new-connecion-time.
* Random password and it's enable state will not be recovered yet.

title: feat(pynput): Support dead key
body:
# Context

There may be multiple keycodes for the default keysym in keyboard_mapping. Continuing to use keyboard_mapping will give an error.

Dead keys will get different keycodes from display and keyboard_mapping. We should replace with the corresponding keysym.
https://www.cl.cam.ac.uk/~mgk25/ucs/keysymdef.h

# Changelog

- Replace the default keyboard_mapping.
- Handling of dead keys.

# Test

The most character key of German keyboard and French keyboard

author: chiehw
title: fix: Shift + (  in french keyboard
body:
#406

## Context

On a French keyboard, the keycode for both `(` and `5` should be 14, but the keycode for `(` in pynput is 187. Use xlib's `keysym_to_keycode` fixes this bug. 
```python3
from pynput.keyboard import Controller, KeyCode
import os

from Xlib.display import Display

keyboard = Controller()

pynput_keysym = keyboard._keysym(KeyCode.from_char('('))
print(f'pynput keysym: {pynput_keysym}')  # 40
pynput_keycode = keyboard.keyboard_mapping[pynput_keysym]
print(f'pynput keysym: {pynput_keycode}')  # (187, 0)

_display = Display(os.environ['DISPLAY'])

PARENLEFT_KEYSYM = 40
keycode = _display.keysym_to_keycode(PARENLEFT_KEYSYM)
print(f'xlib keycode: {keycode}')   # 14
# If the default input source is a US keyboard, keycode is 187
```

## Changelog
- Replaced pynput's `keyboard_mapping` with xlib's `keysym_to_keycode`.
- Replaced pynput's `_send_key` with xlib's `send_event`.
- Removed a useless code.

## Feedback wanted

I tested the US keyboard and the French keyboard, everything works fine, do I need to test other keyboards?

author: fufesou
title: Fix WCHAR Path & Add Resources Integration Lib
body:
OS: Win10

1. Fixed: IDD driver use wchar instead of utf-8 path.
2. Add: simple_rc. Integrate kinds of files. Reading resources to a resource file. Then extract the resources to a target path.

For simple test:
```
mkdir resources >nul
echo "test file" > resources\test.txt
mkdir resources\f1 >nul
echo "test file 2" > resources\f1\test_f2.txt
cargo run --features use_dasp,with_rc -- --extract <target root path>
```

The `simple_rc` lib use configurations bellow.
```
# 
# The output source file
outfile = "src/rc.rs"

# The resource config list.
[[confs]]
# The file or director to integrate.
inc = "D:/projects/windows/RustDeskTempTopMostWindow/x64/Release/xxx"
# The exclusions.
exc = ["*.dll", "*.exe"]
# The front path that will ignore for extracting.
# The following config will make base output path to be "RustDeskTempTopMostWindow/x64/Release/xxx".
suppressed_front = "D:/projects/windows"
```

author: fufesou
title: fix_deadlock_general_service
body:
Signed-off-by: fufesou <shuanglongchen@yeah.net>

[`self.0.write().unwrap().handle.take().map(JoinHandle::join);`](https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/blob/7c2cf6c9b37a19887094113a8266db43f0c9e1ac/src/server/service.rs#L92)

Thread handle join hold the write lock.
While [`sp.active()`](https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/blob/7c2cf6c9b37a19887094113a8266db43f0c9e1ac/src/server/service.rs#L188) hold the read lock.

author: 64kramsystem
title: Remove `remote.rs` static mut booleans unsafe code, by using AtomicBool
body:
## Description

For supported types, static R/W globals unsafe code can be replaced by safe `Atomic*` types.

The pattern of usage is simple; example with `KEYBOARD_HOOKED`:

- AtomicBool#swap is used to fetch the old `KEYBOARD_HOOKED` value, while setting it to true;
- if the old value was true, there is effectively no change to `KEYBOARD_HOOKED`, and the flow exits from the enclosing function;
- if the old value was false, execute the function (the new `KEYBOARD_HOOKED` has been set to true by swap()).

All the other variables use simply `load`/`store`.

The most conservative ordering is used, as the context is not performance-sensitive (it doesn't matter, anyway, in this context).

Atomics are not supported on every platform, but the project assumes x86-64, which supports them.

## Testing

- connected (successfully) to a remote server, and observed the variable `KEYBOARD_HOOKED`/`IS_IN` values before/during/after the test
- connected to a remote server, and (successfully) enabled/disaled keyboard input (wrt `SERVER_KEYBOARD_ENABLED`)
- connected to a remote server, and (successfully) enabled/disaled clipboard paste (wrt `SERVER_CLIPBOARD_ENABLED`)

## Notes

- `SERVER_FILE_TRANSFER_ENABLED` seems not to have effect on the workflow I've tried; regardless of it being enabled/disabled, when the client initiates a file send, the server instantiates a new connection (window); this is the same in master

author: chriscavalluzzi
title: Add dark theme for main desktop client window
body:
![main](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8498433/169674639-ba2a8bee-c664-4cde-86c5-f3d2460c417d.png)

This change implements a dark mode for the main desktop client window. The scope is limited to only the main window to make sure that the implementation is accepted and agreed upon before I go any further with it.

The theme switching is performed by adding a new class to the root HTML tag, which contains overrides for the already-used color variables.

### Feature Limitations

- The dark theme applies to only the main desktop window at this time. If this implementation is accepted, we should be able to extend this functionality to the other windows.
- I was unable to figure out how to override the `svg_checkmark` hover color in the settings popup, so they currently look a little awkward in the dark theme. They should become brighter when hovered, but currently they get darker.

### Testing Limitations

- When attempting to run debug tests, my cargo only found 2 total tests, and I'm not sure if that is correct. If there should be more tests and you would like me to verify them, please let me know.
- I am very new to RustDesk (I only discovered it a couple days ago), so although I have done my best to test every prompt and message box that I could find, it would probably be a good idea if someone with more experience performed a little testing to make sure I didn't make a critical piece of UI unreadable.
- I have only tested this on Windows 10. If more platform testing is desired, I can probably get Linux installed on a device somewhere, just let me know.

### Other Notes

- Apologies for the semi-large commit. Since changing the background color immediately "broke" the readability of most UI elements, the program wasn't usable until all the UI elements had been updated, so I figured it would be best to squash it all into a single commit.
- I am not a UI designer by any means, but I used Google's [Material Design Dark Theme documentation](https://material.io/design/color/dark-theme.html) to get an idea for how the colors should work. I did my best to respect the original theme's design while making the dark theme accessible.
- I named the dark theme config variable `allow-darktheme` instead of `enable-darktheme` to ensure that it was not enabled by default. If this is undesired, please let me know.
- I did not use a click event for the dark theme toggle option in the settings menu because I was unsure if the event would reliably fire only _after_ the variable was toggled. If this is undesired, please let me know.
- I added a new color variable called `menu-hover`, which is to retain the light-blue hover color in the settings popup, while being able to override it for the dark theme.

### Screenshots
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8498433/169674677-cf7e5f62-a710-413d-91b0-1246199d0c19.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8498433/169674684-13166012-ccd7-4eb9-8e4d-b51dd916a9f7.png)
![server popup](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8498433/169674822-e5f953de-0b5b-4f3b-b508-97016c511a4b.png)
![list](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8498433/169674789-1cdc62d8-2f06-4c41-b375-8ae98484192a.png)

author: Kingtous
title: fix: Unix <-> Windows sub-folder collapsed
body:
This PR fixs the problem described below:

Scene: unix(local) <- windows(remote), transfering folder, which layout is:

- folder
  - subfolder
    - test.txt
  - test2.txt

origin version of rustdesk, the `subfolder` disappeared, and recognizes the folder as a part of the name of `test.txt`, which is `subfolder\\test.txt`.

This PR add the fix, which will transform "\\" to "/" when:
- remote is Windows.
- local is Unix based system.

author: jkhsjdhjs
title: enigo: check /usr/lib/rustdesk for pynput_service.py
body:
I'm packaging the binary version of rustdesk for the AUR. According to the Arch Linux packaging guidelines, additional application modules such as the `pynput_service.py` should be installed to `/usr/lib/{pkg}`, where `pkg` is the name of the application (see https://wiki.archlinux.org/title/Arch_package_guidelines#Directories). This also applies to most other distributions which follow the Filesystem Hierarchy Standard (FHS). Thus it would be great to have rustdesk/enigo check `/usr/lib/rustdesk` for the pynput service script.

This PR makes enigo check `/usr/lib/rustdesk` for `pynput_service.py` in addition to the current behavior of checking the current working directory and `/usr/share/rustdesk/files`.

author: Kingtous
title: opt: file transfer can resume when encountering reconnecting or close&open window
body:
This PR brings more flexible network requirements when transfering. Improvements are listed below:

- Supports resuming file transfer by resending send request.
- Supports resuming folder transfer by sending offset of the uncompleted index to the remote.

Time to trigger the logic of resuming file-transfer progress:
- when reopen file transfer window if transfer lists was not fully complete in the prior file-transfer progress and the tranfer window was closed.
- when reconnection behavior is triggered (poor network, etc.) and successfully reconnect to the remote server.

author: fufesou
title: Fix WCHAR Path & Add Resources Integration Lib
body:
OS: Win10

1. Fixed: IDD driver use utf-8 path.
2. Add: simple_rc. Integrate kinds of files. Reading resources to a resource file. Then extract the resources to a target path.

```
# 
# The output source file
outfile = "src/rc.rs"

# The resource config list.
[[confs]]
# The file or director to integrate.
inc = "D:/projects/windows/RustDeskTempTopMostWindow/x64/Release/xxx"
# The exclusions.
exc = ["*.dll", "*.exe"]
# The front path that will ignore for extracting.
# The following config will make base output path to be "RustDeskTempTopMostWindow/x64/Release/xxx".
suppressed_front = "D:/projects/windows"
```

author: fufesou
title: Privacy mode win magnifier
body:
Implement a privacy mode method like ToDesk on windows OS.
  1. Draw a window in front of most windows.
  2. The controller side will not see the topmost window.
  3. Diable all user input other than "Ctrl + P", Ctrl + P will exit privacy mode.

Topmost window is implemented by using [DLL injection](https://github.com/fufesou/RustDeskTempTopMostWindow).
[WindowInjection.dll](https://github.com/fufesou/RustDeskTempTopMostWindow/releases/tag/v0.1) need to be downloaded and placed in the same directory of rustdesk.exe.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13586388/162626603-a1b339d9-1a6e-4c42-9e40-19ef221dffd9.png)

Privacy mode is an exclusive mode that will cause others' connections be removed.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13586388/162626743-83675a7b-1574-43b5-9180-e02cbae229a4.png)



**To improve:**
1. Uninstall will not remove WindowInjection.dll. Because it is occupied by RuntimeBroker.exe. The process may not be terminated when uninstall.

* https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/issues/165


This PR use [vcpkg](https://crates.io/crates/vcpkg) to find package.

author: fufesou
title: Virtual display
body:
This PR provide virtual display solution on Win10.
The related driver is [RustDeskIddDriver](https://github.com/fufesou/RustDeskIddDriver).

1. Download [prebuild driver](https://github.com/fufesou/RustDeskIddDriver/releases/download/v0.1/RustDeskIddDriver.zip)[](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13586388/158054707-f204c2b4-cf52-415b-bd13-35fb86cdb85b.png) or build the dirver your self.
2. Extract dirver files to the same directory of rustdesk.exe.
3. Read README.md in the dirver and run the demo. Make sure the environment is correct.
4. Click Install virtual display.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13586388/158811437-49e1e0ed-6576-49a4-a9cc-5d55d60cd43c.png)
5. Virtual display will be installed when no displays are detected. And it will be uninstalled when other displays are detected.

author: fufesou
title: Lan discovery
body:
### Features

Simple Udp server and Lan discovery.

### Simpl udp server

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13586388/146807158-cbcf3563-b44d-48ef-b83e-ff75320a4ede.png)


File: libs\socket_cs\src\udp.rs.

### Lan discovery
One client send discovery message through boardcast.
The others reply their peer info(id, username, hostname).

It only provide a way to add peers automatically.
No connections will not be established.

author: fufesou
title: Lan discovery
body:
#Features

Simple Udp server and Lan discovery.

## Udp server

![simple_udp_server](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13586388/146804968-dd929b13-c64b-4788-9b0e-ec8993875aab.png)


File: libs\socket_cs\src\udp.rs.


## Lan discovery
One client send discovery message through boardcast.
The others reply their peer info(id, username, hostname).

It only provide a way to add peers automatically.
No connections will not be established.

author: starccy
title: Transfer multiple files
body:
To resolve #244.      

Select multiple files by clicking with `Ctrl` or `Shift`, then send/receive or delete them.     

### Attention
Multiple delete functions can not easily be implemented by looping, I have to change and add some ipcs, so it won't work on the lower version. For compatibility, a single selected file still can be deleted as usual, however.        

### Test Case
I have tested some cases manually to make sure it works as usual:           

| Description | Expected | Real |
| ------| ------| ------|
| Select a single file/folder, send/receive/delete it. | File be send/receive/deleted both in the list and disk. | Same as expected [ ✅ ] |
| Select some files/folders, send/receive/delete them. | A message box popups to show how many files will be deleted. Skip or confirm to delete. They should be handled with corresponding actions | Same as expected [ ✅ ] |
| Select some files/folders, **delete them on controlled end with lower version app**. | A job inserted into the job table, but it will be "waiting" forever. | Same as expected [ ✅ ] |
| Select a single file/folder, **delete them on controlled end with lower version app**.  | File will be deleted as usual. | Same as expected [ ✅ ] |

author: hatamiarash7
title: Update Readme & Other Markdown files
body:
- Remove extra space after `git clone` command

```sh
git clone https://github.com/microsoft/vcpkg
```

---

- Add `VCPKG_ROOT` env before `cargo run` command

```sh
VCPKG_ROOT=$HOME/vcpkg cargo run
```

This will make the next runs easier ( don't need to add the environment variable permanently )

---

Fix syntax problems in all Markdown files ( Security, Contributing, Readme, ... )

author: TopsDesk
title: Target inline, use archived .html, .css and .tis files else use it from src dir
body:
use the following command to create a compressed archive and use it with feature "inline" 
> packfolder ui resources.rc -i "*.html;*.css;*.tis" -v "resources" -binary

When feature inline is not defined then use resource files from "src" directory.  this helps in testing the tis, css and html files.
files: Cargo.toml, icon.ico, manifest.xml, src/makerc.bat, src/platform/windows.rs, src/resources.rc, src/ui.rs, src/ui/common.css, src/ui/icon.ico, src/ui/index.css, src/ui/index.tis, src/ui/remote.rs, zbuild.bat

author: TopsDesk
title: User archive resources and bundled DLLs for Win/Mac/Lin
body: This change implements archived/compressed resources in the executable. Changes are in man.rs and ui.rs. I have included the Win/DLL, Lin/so and Mac/dynlib in this branch. Have created a separate res directory and a bat file makerc.bat to create the compressed archive of html, tis, css resources. On windows a DLL is include_bytes to the executable and on linux, a .so file is merged to the executable. Upon execution, the DLL or .so file is written to the same path at the time of execution. If user chooses --install then the DLL or .SO is copied to the target locations. I still need to build on MacOS. I will update the code as needed for macOS

author: sitiom
title: Replace InnoSetup with improved NSIS Setup
body:
Thanks for putting the InnoSetup file. However, I have noticed a couple of problems with it:
- InnoSetup creates its own uninstaller and registry key. Rustdesk already has an uninstall parameter (`--uninstall`) and the InnoSetup uninstaller would just cause inconsistencies. The NSIS Setup uses the `--uninstall` parameter instead and installs in the correct reg key.
- Cannot overwrite RustDesk.exe and does not close process before installing (Fixed in NSIS)
- [Can be run in 32-bit](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/54335154/inno-setup-gets-launched-in-32-bit-even-after-specifying-architecturesinstallin6) (NSIS can still be run in 32-bit stops with an error message)

Here is the [setup file](https://github.com/rustdesk/rustdesk/files/6823235/rustdesk-1.1.6-setup.zip) for testing. If you want to compile it yourself, you need to have NSIS of course.

Closes #100.

author: ToasterUwU
title: German README and correction of links in other MDs ("Deutsche" to "Deutsch")
body:
I was bored and browsed through the "Trending" section of GitHub and then I saw this project.

I love Rust, I love seeing cool stuff made with Rust, you didn't have a german README... So I thought, let's do it.

I tried to stick to the original wording, but I rephrased it if it sounded weird in German. I also changed the "We need your help to translate this README to your native language" to something like "We need your help to make this README better and keep it up to date".

The only "mature" thing I changed was the official server list. I converted it into a table since there is no reason not to and it looks better and is easier to read. ( If wanted I will do the same to the others, so it's the same on all of them )

Hope this helps someone out there and/or makes someone happy. 

Greetings from Germany.

Spanish language is called Español or in some cases Castellano. 
Referring to Spanish language as 'Española' is not grammatically valid.

author: hytracer
title: Creating security guidelines, also known as SECURITY.md
body:
Hey, 
I was checking the security tab of the repo and saw that there were no guidelines related to security issues, so I started creating the `SECURITY.md` file. 
iirc, it will be shown on the security tab of the repo.
How about people (most importantly @rustdesk if you're not busy) help me finishing it and writing the guidelines ? I don't know what kind of guidelines are needed, but having them is really a good idea in case of really important security issues that are discovered.

author: mtoohey31
title: Support builds via Docker
body: This PR adds support and documenation for build via Docker. The entrypoint script ensures the permissions are set correctly on the mountpoint, and grabs any necessary targets. The one improvement that could be made is ensuring the necessary dependancies are present for different platforms, since most of the other platforms I tried (windows, macos, android) failed with libsodium-related errors, so that could use some work at some point.
